2654 ioc->pdev->revision == SAS2_PCI_DEVICE_B0_REVISION) {
2655 return -EINVAL;
2656 }
2657
2658 base = pci_find_capability(ioc->pdev, PCI_CAP_ID_MSIX);
2659 if (!base) {
2660 dfailprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "msix not supported\n",
2661 ioc->name));
2662 return -EINVAL;
2663 }
2664
2665 /* get msix vector count */
2666 /* NUMA_IO not supported for older controllers */
2667 if (ioc->pdev->device == MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2004 ||
2668 ioc->pdev->device == MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2008 ||
2669 ioc->pdev->device == MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2108_1 ||
2670 ioc->pdev->device == MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2108_2 ||
2671 ioc->pdev->device == MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2108_3 ||
2672 ioc->pdev->device == MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2116_1 ||
2673 ioc->pdev->device == MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2116_2)
2674 ioc->msix_vector_count = 1;
2675 else {
2676 pci_read_config_word(ioc->pdev, base + 2, &message_control);
2677 ioc->msix_vector_count = (message_control & 0x3FF) + 1;
2678 }
2679 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
2680 "msix is supported, vector_count(%d)\n",
2681 ioc->name, ioc->msix_vector_count));
2682 return 0;
2683}
2684
2685/**
2686 * _base_free_irq - free irq
2687 * @ioc: per adapter object
2688 *
2689 * Freeing respective reply_queue from the list.
2690 */
2691static void
2692_base_free_irq(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
2693{
2694 struct adapter_reply_queue *reply_q, *next;
2695
2696 if (list_empty(&ioc->reply_queue_list))
2697 return;
2698
2699 list_for_each_entry_safe(reply_q, next, &ioc->reply_queue_list, list) {
2700 list_del(&reply_q->list);
2701 free_irq(pci_irq_vector(ioc->pdev, reply_q->msix_index),
2702 reply_q);
2703 kfree(reply_q);
2704 }
2705}
2706
2707/**
2708 * _base_request_irq - request irq
2709 * @ioc: per adapter object
2710 * @index: msix index into vector table
2711 *
2712 * Inserting respective reply_queue into the list.
2713 */
2714static int
2715_base_request_irq(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u8 index)
2716{
2717 struct pci_dev *pdev = ioc->pdev;
2718 struct adapter_reply_queue *reply_q;
2719 int r;
2720
2721 reply_q = kzalloc(sizeof(struct adapter_reply_queue), GFP_KERNEL);
2722 if (!reply_q) {
2723 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "unable to allocate memory %d!\n",
2724 ioc->name, (int)sizeof(struct adapter_reply_queue));
2725 return -ENOMEM;
2726 }
2727 reply_q->ioc = ioc;
2728 reply_q->msix_index = index;
2729
2730 atomic_set(&reply_q->busy, 0);
2731 if (ioc->msix_enable)
2732 snprintf(reply_q->name, MPT_NAME_LENGTH, "%s%d-msix%d",
2733 ioc->driver_name, ioc->id, index);
2734 else
2735 snprintf(reply_q->name, MPT_NAME_LENGTH, "%s%d",
2736 ioc->driver_name, ioc->id);
2737 r = request_irq(pci_irq_vector(pdev, index), _base_interrupt,
2738 IRQF_SHARED, reply_q->name, reply_q);
2739 if (r) {
2740 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "unable to allocate interrupt %d!\n",
2741 reply_q->name, pci_irq_vector(pdev, index));
2742 kfree(reply_q);
2743 return -EBUSY;
2744 }
2745
2746 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&reply_q->list);
2747 list_add_tail(&reply_q->list, &ioc->reply_queue_list);
2748 return 0;
2749}
2750
2751/**
2752 * _base_assign_reply_queues - assigning msix index for each cpu
2753 * @ioc: per adapter object
2754 *
2755 * The enduser would need to set the affinity via /proc/irq/#/smp_affinity
2756 *
2757 * It would nice if we could call irq_set_affinity, however it is not
2758 * an exported symbol
2759 */
2760static void
2761_base_assign_reply_queues(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
2762{
2763 unsigned int cpu, nr_cpus, nr_msix, index = 0;
2764 struct adapter_reply_queue *reply_q;
2765
2766 if (!_base_is_controller_msix_enabled(ioc))
2767 return;
2768
2769 memset(ioc->cpu_msix_table, 0, ioc->cpu_msix_table_sz);
2770
2771 nr_cpus = num_online_cpus();
2772 nr_msix = ioc->reply_queue_count = min(ioc->reply_queue_count,
2773 ioc->facts.MaxMSIxVectors);
2774 if (!nr_msix)
2775 return;
2776
2777 if (smp_affinity_enable) {
2778 list_for_each_entry(reply_q, &ioc->reply_queue_list, list) {
2779 const cpumask_t *mask = pci_irq_get_affinity(ioc->pdev,
2780 reply_q->msix_index);
2781 if (!mask) {
2782 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT "no affinity for msi %x\n",
2783 ioc->name, reply_q->msix_index);
2784 continue;
2785 }
2786
2787 for_each_cpu_and(cpu, mask, cpu_online_mask) {
2788 if (cpu >= ioc->cpu_msix_table_sz)
2789 break;
2790 ioc->cpu_msix_table[cpu] = reply_q->msix_index;
2791 }
2792 }
2793 return;
2794 }
2795 cpu = cpumask_first(cpu_online_mask);
2796
2797 list_for_each_entry(reply_q, &ioc->reply_queue_list, list) {
2798
2799 unsigned int i, group = nr_cpus / nr_msix;
2800
2801 if (cpu >= nr_cpus)
2802 break;
2803
2804 if (index < nr_cpus % nr_msix)
2805 group++;
2806
2807 for (i = 0 ; i < group ; i++) {
2808 ioc->cpu_msix_table[cpu] = reply_q->msix_index;
2809 cpu = cpumask_next(cpu, cpu_online_mask);
2810 }
2811 index++;
2812 }
2813}
2814
2815/**
2816 * _base_disable_msix - disables msix
2817 * @ioc: per adapter object
2818 *
2819 */
2820static void
2821_base_disable_msix(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
2822{
2823 if (!ioc->msix_enable)
2824 return;
2825 pci_disable_msix(ioc->pdev);
2826 ioc->msix_enable = 0;
2827}
2828
2829/**
2830 * _base_enable_msix - enables msix, failback to io_apic
2831 * @ioc: per adapter object
2832 *
2833 */
2834static int
2835_base_enable_msix(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
2836{
2837 int r;
2838 int i, local_max_msix_vectors;
2839 u8 try_msix = 0;
2840 unsigned int irq_flags = PCI_IRQ_MSIX;
2841
2842 if (msix_disable == -1 || msix_disable == 0)
2843 try_msix = 1;
2844
2845 if (!try_msix)
2846 goto try_ioapic;
2847
2848 if (_base_check_enable_msix(ioc) != 0)
2849 goto try_ioapic;
2850
2851 ioc->reply_queue_count = min_t(int, ioc->cpu_count,
2852 ioc->msix_vector_count);
2853
2854 printk(MPT3SAS_FMT "MSI-X vectors supported: %d, no of cores"
2855 ": %d, max_msix_vectors: %d\n", ioc->name, ioc->msix_vector_count,
2856 ioc->cpu_count, max_msix_vectors);
2857
2858 if (!ioc->rdpq_array_enable && max_msix_vectors == -1)
2859 local_max_msix_vectors = (reset_devices) ? 1 : 8;
2860 else
2861 local_max_msix_vectors = max_msix_vectors;
2862
2863 if (local_max_msix_vectors > 0)
2864 ioc->reply_queue_count = min_t(int, local_max_msix_vectors,
2865 ioc->reply_queue_count);
2866 else if (local_max_msix_vectors == 0)
2867 goto try_ioapic;
2868
2869 if (ioc->msix_vector_count < ioc->cpu_count)
2870 smp_affinity_enable = 0;
2871
2872 if (smp_affinity_enable)
2873 irq_flags |= PCI_IRQ_AFFINITY;
2874
2875 r = pci_alloc_irq_vectors(ioc->pdev, 1, ioc->reply_queue_count,
2876 irq_flags);
2877 if (r < 0) {
2878 dfailprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
2879 "pci_alloc_irq_vectors failed (r=%d) !!!\n",
2880 ioc->name, r));
2881 goto try_ioapic;
2882 }
2883
2884 ioc->msix_enable = 1;
2885 ioc->reply_queue_count = r;
2886 for (i = 0; i < ioc->reply_queue_count; i++) {
2887 r = _base_request_irq(ioc, i);
2888 if (r) {
2889 _base_free_irq(ioc);
2890 _base_disable_msix(ioc);
2891 goto try_ioapic;
2892 }
2893 }
2894
2895 return 0;
2896
2897/* failback to io_apic interrupt routing */
2898 try_ioapic:
2899
2900 ioc->reply_queue_count = 1;
2901 r = pci_alloc_irq_vectors(ioc->pdev, 1, 1, PCI_IRQ_LEGACY);
2902 if (r < 0) {
2903 dfailprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
2904 "pci_alloc_irq_vector(legacy) failed (r=%d) !!!\n",
2905 ioc->name, r));
2906 } else
2907 r = _base_request_irq(ioc, 0);
2908
2909 return r;
2910}
2911
2912/**
2913 * mpt3sas_base_unmap_resources - free controller resources
2914 * @ioc: per adapter object
2915 */
2916static void
2917mpt3sas_base_unmap_resources(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
2918{
2919 struct pci_dev *pdev = ioc->pdev;
2920
2921 dexitprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n",
2922 ioc->name, __func__));
2923
2924 _base_free_irq(ioc);
2925 _base_disable_msix(ioc);
2926
2927 if (ioc->combined_reply_queue) {
2928 kfree(ioc->replyPostRegisterIndex);
2929 ioc->replyPostRegisterIndex = NULL;
2930 }
2931
2932 if (ioc->chip_phys) {
2933 iounmap(ioc->chip);
2934 ioc->chip_phys = 0;
2935 }
2936
2937 if (pci_is_enabled(pdev)) {
2938 pci_release_selected_regions(ioc->pdev, ioc->bars);
2939 pci_disable_pcie_error_reporting(pdev);
2940 pci_disable_device(pdev);
2941 }
2942}
2943
2944/**
2945 * mpt3sas_base_map_resources - map in controller resources (io/irq/memap)
2946 * @ioc: per adapter object
2947 *
2948 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
2949 */
2950int
2951mpt3sas_base_map_resources(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
2952{
2953 struct pci_dev *pdev = ioc->pdev;
2954 u32 memap_sz;
2955 u32 pio_sz;
2956 int i, r = 0;
2957 u64 pio_chip = 0;
2958 phys_addr_t chip_phys = 0;
2959 struct adapter_reply_queue *reply_q;
2960
2961 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n",
2962 ioc->name, __func__));
2963
2964 ioc->bars = pci_select_bars(pdev, IORESOURCE_MEM);
2965 if (pci_enable_device_mem(pdev)) {
2966 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT "pci_enable_device_mem: failed\n",
2967 ioc->name);
2968 ioc->bars = 0;
2969 return -ENODEV;
2970 }
2971
2972
2973 if (pci_request_selected_regions(pdev, ioc->bars,
2974 ioc->driver_name)) {
2975 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT "pci_request_selected_regions: failed\n",
2976 ioc->name);
2977 ioc->bars = 0;
2978 r = -ENODEV;
2979 goto out_fail;
2980 }
2981
2982/* AER (Advanced Error Reporting) hooks */
2983 pci_enable_pcie_error_reporting(pdev);
2984
2985 pci_set_master(pdev);
2986
2987
2988 if (_base_config_dma_addressing(ioc, pdev) != 0) {
2989 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT "no suitable DMA mask for %s\n",
2990 ioc->name, pci_name(pdev));
2991 r = -ENODEV;
2992 goto out_fail;
2993 }
2994
2995 for (i = 0, memap_sz = 0, pio_sz = 0; (i < DEVICE_COUNT_RESOURCE) &&
2996 (!memap_sz || !pio_sz); i++) {
2997 if (pci_resource_flags(pdev, i) & IORESOURCE_IO) {
2998 if (pio_sz)
2999 continue;
3000 pio_chip = (u64)pci_resource_start(pdev, i);
3001 pio_sz = pci_resource_len(pdev, i);
3002 } else if (pci_resource_flags(pdev, i) & IORESOURCE_MEM) {
3003 if (memap_sz)
3004 continue;
3005 ioc->chip_phys = pci_resource_start(pdev, i);
3006 chip_phys = ioc->chip_phys;
3007 memap_sz = pci_resource_len(pdev, i);
3008 ioc->chip = ioremap(ioc->chip_phys, memap_sz);
3009 }
3010 }
3011
3012 if (ioc->chip == NULL) {
3013 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "unable to map adapter memory! "
3014 " or resource not found\n", ioc->name);
3015 r = -EINVAL;
3016 goto out_fail;
3017 }
3018
3019 _base_mask_interrupts(ioc);
3020
3021 r = _base_get_ioc_facts(ioc);
3022 if (r)
3023 goto out_fail;
3024
3025 if (!ioc->rdpq_array_enable_assigned) {
3026 ioc->rdpq_array_enable = ioc->rdpq_array_capable;
3027 ioc->rdpq_array_enable_assigned = 1;
3028 }
3029
3030 r = _base_enable_msix(ioc);
3031 if (r)
3032 goto out_fail;
3033
3034 /* Use the Combined reply queue feature only for SAS3 C0 & higher
3035 * revision HBAs and also only when reply queue count is greater than 8
3036 */
3037 if (ioc->combined_reply_queue && ioc->reply_queue_count > 8) {
3038 /* Determine the Supplemental Reply Post Host Index Registers
3039 * Addresse. Supplemental Reply Post Host Index Registers
3040 * starts at offset MPI25_SUP_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_OFFSET and
3041 * each register is at offset bytes of
3042 * MPT3_SUP_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_REG_OFFSET from previous one.
3043 */
3044 ioc->replyPostRegisterIndex = kcalloc(
3045 ioc->combined_reply_index_count,
3046 sizeof(resource_size_t *), GFP_KERNEL);
3047 if (!ioc->replyPostRegisterIndex) {
3048 dfailprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT
3049 "allocation for reply Post Register Index failed!!!\n",
3050 ioc->name));
3051 r = -ENOMEM;
3052 goto out_fail;
3053 }
3054
3055 for (i = 0; i < ioc->combined_reply_index_count; i++) {
3056 ioc->replyPostRegisterIndex[i] = (resource_size_t *)
3057 ((u8 __force *)&ioc->chip->Doorbell +
3058 MPI25_SUP_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_OFFSET +
3059 (i * MPT3_SUP_REPLY_POST_HOST_INDEX_REG_OFFSET));
3060 }
3061 } else
3062 ioc->combined_reply_queue = 0;
3063
3064 if (ioc->is_warpdrive) {
3065 ioc->reply_post_host_index[0] = (resource_size_t __iomem *)
3066 &ioc->chip->ReplyPostHostIndex;
3067
3068 for (i = 1; i < ioc->cpu_msix_table_sz; i++)
3069 ioc->reply_post_host_index[i] =
3070 (resource_size_t __iomem *)
3071 ((u8 __iomem *)&ioc->chip->Doorbell + (0x4000 + ((i - 1)
3072 * 4)));
3073 }
3074
3075 list_for_each_entry(reply_q, &ioc->reply_queue_list, list)
3076 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: IRQ %d\n",
3077 reply_q->name, ((ioc->msix_enable) ? "PCI-MSI-X enabled" :
3078 "IO-APIC enabled"),
3079 pci_irq_vector(ioc->pdev, reply_q->msix_index));
3080
3081 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "iomem(%pap), mapped(0x%p), size(%d)\n",
3082 ioc->name, &chip_phys, ioc->chip, memap_sz);
3083 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "ioport(0x%016llx), size(%d)\n",
3084 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)pio_chip, pio_sz);
3085
3086 /* Save PCI configuration state for recovery from PCI AER/EEH errors */
3087 pci_save_state(pdev);
3088 return 0;
3089
3090 out_fail:
3091 mpt3sas_base_unmap_resources(ioc);
3092 return r;
3093}
3094
3095/**
3096 * mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame - obtain request mf pointer
3097 * @ioc: per adapter object
3098 * @smid: system request message index(smid zero is invalid)
3099 *
3100 * Returns virt pointer to message frame.
3101 */
3102void *
3103mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u16 smid)
3104{
3105 return (void *)(ioc->request + (smid * ioc->request_sz));
3106}

3175
3176static inline u8
3177_base_get_msix_index(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3178{
3179 return ioc->cpu_msix_table[raw_smp_processor_id()];
3180}
3181
3182/**
3183 * mpt3sas_base_get_smid - obtain a free smid from internal queue
3184 * @ioc: per adapter object
3185 * @cb_idx: callback index
3186 *
3187 * Returns smid (zero is invalid)
3188 */
3189u16
3190mpt3sas_base_get_smid(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u8 cb_idx)
3191{
3192 unsigned long flags;
3193 struct request_tracker *request;
3194 u16 smid;
3195
3196 spin_lock_irqsave(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3197 if (list_empty(&ioc->internal_free_list)) {
3198 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3199 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: smid not available\n",
3200 ioc->name, __func__);
3201 return 0;
3202 }
3203
3204 request = list_entry(ioc->internal_free_list.next,
3205 struct request_tracker, tracker_list);
3206 request->cb_idx = cb_idx;
3207 smid = request->smid;
3208 list_del(&request->tracker_list);
3209 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3210 return smid;
3211}
3212
3213/**
3214 * mpt3sas_base_get_smid_scsiio - obtain a free smid from scsiio queue
3215 * @ioc: per adapter object
3216 * @cb_idx: callback index
3217 * @scmd: pointer to scsi command object
3218 *
3219 * Returns smid (zero is invalid)
3220 */
3221u16
3222mpt3sas_base_get_smid_scsiio(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u8 cb_idx,
3223 struct scsi_cmnd *scmd)
3224{
3225 struct scsiio_tracker *request = scsi_cmd_priv(scmd);
3226 unsigned int tag = scmd->request->tag;
3227 u16 smid;
3228
3229 smid = tag + 1;
3230 request->cb_idx = cb_idx;
3231 request->msix_io = _base_get_msix_index(ioc);
3232 request->smid = smid;
3233 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&request->chain_list);
3234 return smid;
3235}
3236
3237/**
3238 * mpt3sas_base_get_smid_hpr - obtain a free smid from hi-priority queue
3239 * @ioc: per adapter object
3240 * @cb_idx: callback index
3241 *
3242 * Returns smid (zero is invalid)
3243 */
3244u16
3245mpt3sas_base_get_smid_hpr(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u8 cb_idx)
3246{
3247 unsigned long flags;
3248 struct request_tracker *request;
3249 u16 smid;
3250
3251 spin_lock_irqsave(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3252 if (list_empty(&ioc->hpr_free_list)) {
3253 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3254 return 0;
3255 }
3256
3257 request = list_entry(ioc->hpr_free_list.next,
3258 struct request_tracker, tracker_list);
3259 request->cb_idx = cb_idx;
3260 smid = request->smid;
3261 list_del(&request->tracker_list);
3262 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3263 return smid;
3264}
3265
3266static void
3267_base_recovery_check(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3268{
3269 /*
3270 * See _wait_for_commands_to_complete() call with regards to this code.
3271 */
3272 if (ioc->shost_recovery && ioc->pending_io_count) {
3273 ioc->pending_io_count = atomic_read(&ioc->shost->host_busy);
3274 if (ioc->pending_io_count == 0)
3275 wake_up(&ioc->reset_wq);
3276 }
3277}
3278
3279void mpt3sas_base_clear_st(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
3280 struct scsiio_tracker *st)
3281{
3282 if (WARN_ON(st->smid == 0))
3283 return;
3284 st->cb_idx = 0xFF;
3285 st->direct_io = 0;
3286 atomic_set(&ioc->chain_lookup[st->smid - 1].chain_offset, 0);
3287 st->smid = 0;
3288}
3289
3290/**
3291 * mpt3sas_base_free_smid - put smid back on free_list
3292 * @ioc: per adapter object
3293 * @smid: system request message index
3294 *
3295 * Return nothing.
3296 */
3297void
3298mpt3sas_base_free_smid(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u16 smid)
3299{
3300 unsigned long flags;
3301 int i;
3302
3303 if (smid < ioc->hi_priority_smid) {
3304 struct scsiio_tracker *st;
3305
3306 st = _get_st_from_smid(ioc, smid);
3307 if (!st) {
3308 _base_recovery_check(ioc);
3309 return;
3310 }
3311 mpt3sas_base_clear_st(ioc, st);
3312 _base_recovery_check(ioc);
3313 return;
3314 }
3315
3316 spin_lock_irqsave(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3317 if (smid < ioc->internal_smid) {
3318 /* hi-priority */
3319 i = smid - ioc->hi_priority_smid;
3320 ioc->hpr_lookup[i].cb_idx = 0xFF;
3321 list_add(&ioc->hpr_lookup[i].tracker_list, &ioc->hpr_free_list);
3322 } else if (smid <= ioc->hba_queue_depth) {
3323 /* internal queue */
3324 i = smid - ioc->internal_smid;
3325 ioc->internal_lookup[i].cb_idx = 0xFF;
3326 list_add(&ioc->internal_lookup[i].tracker_list,
3327 &ioc->internal_free_list);
3328 }
3329 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
3330}
3331
3332/**
3333 * _base_mpi_ep_writeq - 32 bit write to MMIO
3334 * @b: data payload
3335 * @addr: address in MMIO space
3336 * @writeq_lock: spin lock
3337 *
3338 * This special handling for MPI EP to take care of 32 bit
3339 * environment where its not quarenteed to send the entire word
3340 * in one transfer.
3341 */
3342static inline void
3343_base_mpi_ep_writeq(__u64 b, volatile void __iomem *addr,
3344 spinlock_t *writeq_lock)
3345{
3346 unsigned long flags;
3347
3348 spin_lock_irqsave(writeq_lock, flags);
3349 __raw_writel((u32)(b), addr);
3350 __raw_writel((u32)(b >> 32), (addr + 4));
3351 mmiowb();
3352 spin_unlock_irqrestore(writeq_lock, flags);
3353}
3354
3355/**
3356 * _base_writeq - 64 bit write to MMIO
3357 * @ioc: per adapter object
3358 * @b: data payload
3359 * @addr: address in MMIO space
3360 * @writeq_lock: spin lock
3361 *
3362 * Glue for handling an atomic 64 bit word to MMIO. This special handling takes
3363 * care of 32 bit environment where its not quarenteed to send the entire word
3364 * in one transfer.
3365 */
3366#if defined(writeq) && defined(CONFIG_64BIT)
3367static inline void
3368_base_writeq(__u64 b, volatile void __iomem *addr, spinlock_t *writeq_lock)
3369{
3370 __raw_writeq(b, addr);
3371 mmiowb();
3372}
3373#else
3374static inline void
3375_base_writeq(__u64 b, volatile void __iomem *addr, spinlock_t *writeq_lock)
3376{
3377 _base_mpi_ep_writeq(b, addr, writeq_lock);
3378}
3379#endif
3380
3381/**
3382 * _base_put_smid_mpi_ep_scsi_io - send SCSI_IO request to firmware
3383 * @ioc: per adapter object
3384 * @smid: system request message index
3385 * @handle: device handle
3386 *
3387 * Return nothing.
3388 */
3389static void
3390_base_put_smid_mpi_ep_scsi_io(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u16 smid, u16 handle)
3391{
3392 Mpi2RequestDescriptorUnion_t descriptor;
3393 u64 *request = (u64 *)&descriptor;
3394 void *mpi_req_iomem;
3395 __le32 *mfp = (__le32 *)mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
3396
3397 _clone_sg_entries(ioc, (void *) mfp, smid);
3398 mpi_req_iomem = (void __force *)ioc->chip +
3399 MPI_FRAME_START_OFFSET + (smid * ioc->request_sz);
3400 _base_clone_mpi_to_sys_mem(mpi_req_iomem, (void *)mfp,
3401 ioc->request_sz);
3402 descriptor.SCSIIO.RequestFlags = MPI2_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_SCSI_IO;
3403 descriptor.SCSIIO.MSIxIndex = _base_get_msix_index(ioc);
3404 descriptor.SCSIIO.SMID = cpu_to_le16(smid);
3405 descriptor.SCSIIO.DevHandle = cpu_to_le16(handle);
3406 descriptor.SCSIIO.LMID = 0;
3407 _base_mpi_ep_writeq(*request, &ioc->chip->RequestDescriptorPostLow,
3408 &ioc->scsi_lookup_lock);
3409}

3460/**
3461 * mpt3sas_base_put_smid_hi_priority - send Task Management request to firmware
3462 * @ioc: per adapter object
3463 * @smid: system request message index
3464 * @msix_task: msix_task will be same as msix of IO incase of task abort else 0.
3465 * Return nothing.
3466 */
3467void
3468mpt3sas_base_put_smid_hi_priority(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u16 smid,
3469 u16 msix_task)
3470{
3471 Mpi2RequestDescriptorUnion_t descriptor;
3472 void *mpi_req_iomem;
3473 u64 *request;
3474
3475 if (ioc->is_mcpu_endpoint) {
3476 MPI2RequestHeader_t *request_hdr;
3477
3478 __le32 *mfp = (__le32 *)mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
3479
3480 request_hdr = (MPI2RequestHeader_t *)mfp;
3481 /* TBD 256 is offset within sys register. */
3482 mpi_req_iomem = (void __force *)ioc->chip
3483 + MPI_FRAME_START_OFFSET
3484 + (smid * ioc->request_sz);
3485 _base_clone_mpi_to_sys_mem(mpi_req_iomem, (void *)mfp,
3486 ioc->request_sz);
3487 }
3488
3489 request = (u64 *)&descriptor;
3490
3491 descriptor.HighPriority.RequestFlags =
3492 MPI2_REQ_DESCRIPT_FLAGS_HIGH_PRIORITY;
3493 descriptor.HighPriority.MSIxIndex = msix_task;
3494 descriptor.HighPriority.SMID = cpu_to_le16(smid);
3495 descriptor.HighPriority.LMID = 0;
3496 descriptor.HighPriority.Reserved1 = 0;
3497 if (ioc->is_mcpu_endpoint)
3498 _base_mpi_ep_writeq(*request,
3499 &ioc->chip->RequestDescriptorPostLow,
3500 &ioc->scsi_lookup_lock);
3501 else
3502 _base_writeq(*request, &ioc->chip->RequestDescriptorPostLow,
3503 &ioc->scsi_lookup_lock);
3504}

3572/**

3574 * @ioc: per adapter object
3575 *
3576 * Return nothing.
3577 */
3578static void
3579_base_display_OEMs_branding(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3580{
3581 if (ioc->pdev->subsystem_vendor != PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL)
3582 return;
3583
3584 switch (ioc->pdev->subsystem_vendor) {
3585 case PCI_VENDOR_ID_INTEL:
3586 switch (ioc->pdev->device) {
3587 case MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2008:
3588 switch (ioc->pdev->subsystem_device) {
3589 case MPT2SAS_INTEL_RMS2LL080_SSDID:
3590 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
3591 MPT2SAS_INTEL_RMS2LL080_BRANDING);
3592 break;
3593 case MPT2SAS_INTEL_RMS2LL040_SSDID:
3594 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
3595 MPT2SAS_INTEL_RMS2LL040_BRANDING);
3596 break;
3597 case MPT2SAS_INTEL_SSD910_SSDID:
3598 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
3599 MPT2SAS_INTEL_SSD910_BRANDING);
3600 break;
3601 default:
3602 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
3603 "Intel(R) Controller: Subsystem ID: 0x%X\n",
3604 ioc->name, ioc->pdev->subsystem_device);
3605 break;
3606 }
3607 case MPI2_MFGPAGE_DEVID_SAS2308_2:
3608 switch (ioc->pdev->subsystem_device) {
3609 case MPT2SAS_INTEL_RS25GB008_SSDID:
3610 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
3611 MPT2SAS_INTEL_RS25GB008_BRANDING);

3620 break;
3621 case MPT2SAS_INTEL_RMS25KB080_SSDID:
3622 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,

3640 ioc->name, ioc->pdev->subsystem_device);
3641 break;

3644 switch (ioc->pdev->subsystem_device) {
3645 case MPT3SAS_INTEL_RMS3JC080_SSDID:

3832/**
3833 * _base_display_fwpkg_version - sends FWUpload request to pull FWPkg
3834 * version from FW Image Header.
3835 * @ioc: per adapter object
3836 *
3837 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
3838 */
3839 static int
3840_base_display_fwpkg_version(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3841{
3842 Mpi2FWImageHeader_t *FWImgHdr;
3843 Mpi25FWUploadRequest_t *mpi_request;
3844 Mpi2FWUploadReply_t mpi_reply;
3845 int r = 0;
3846 void *fwpkg_data = NULL;
3847 dma_addr_t fwpkg_data_dma;
3848 u16 smid, ioc_status;
3849 size_t data_length;
3850
3851 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
3852 __func__));
3853
3854 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
3855 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: internal command already in use\n",
3856 ioc->name, __func__);
3857 return -EAGAIN;
3858 }
3859
3860 data_length = sizeof(Mpi2FWImageHeader_t);
3861 fwpkg_data = pci_alloc_consistent(ioc->pdev, data_length,
3862 &fwpkg_data_dma);
3863 if (!fwpkg_data) {
3864 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "failure at %s:%d/%s()!\n",
3865 ioc->name, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__);
3866 return -ENOMEM;
3867 }
3868
3869 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->base_cb_idx);
3870 if (!smid) {
3871 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
3872 ioc->name, __func__);
3873 r = -EAGAIN;
3874 goto out;
3875 }
3876
3877 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
3878 mpi_request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
3879 ioc->base_cmds.smid = smid;
3880 memset(mpi_request, 0, sizeof(Mpi25FWUploadRequest_t));
3881 mpi_request->Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_FW_UPLOAD;
3882 mpi_request->ImageType = MPI2_FW_UPLOAD_ITYPE_FW_FLASH;
3883 mpi_request->ImageSize = cpu_to_le32(data_length);
3884 ioc->build_sg(ioc, &mpi_request->SGL, 0, 0, fwpkg_data_dma,
3885 data_length);
3886 init_completion(&ioc->base_cmds.done);
3887 mpt3sas_base_put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
3888 /* Wait for 15 seconds */
3889 wait_for_completion_timeout(&ioc->base_cmds.done,
3890 FW_IMG_HDR_READ_TIMEOUT*HZ);
3891 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: complete\n",
3892 ioc->name, __func__);
3893 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE)) {
3894 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: timeout\n",
3895 ioc->name, __func__);
3896 _debug_dump_mf(mpi_request,
3897 sizeof(Mpi25FWUploadRequest_t)/4);
3898 r = -ETIME;
3899 } else {
3900 memset(&mpi_reply, 0, sizeof(Mpi2FWUploadReply_t));
3901 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_REPLY_VALID) {
3902 memcpy(&mpi_reply, ioc->base_cmds.reply,
3903 sizeof(Mpi2FWUploadReply_t));
3904 ioc_status = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCStatus) &
3905 MPI2_IOCSTATUS_MASK;
3906 if (ioc_status == MPI2_IOCSTATUS_SUCCESS) {
3907 FWImgHdr = (Mpi2FWImageHeader_t *)fwpkg_data;
3908 if (FWImgHdr->PackageVersion.Word) {
3909 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "FW Package Version"
3910 "(%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d)\n",
3911 ioc->name,
3912 FWImgHdr->PackageVersion.Struct.Major,
3913 FWImgHdr->PackageVersion.Struct.Minor,
3914 FWImgHdr->PackageVersion.Struct.Unit,
3915 FWImgHdr->PackageVersion.Struct.Dev);
3916 }
3917 } else {
3918 _debug_dump_mf(&mpi_reply,
3919 sizeof(Mpi2FWUploadReply_t)/4);
3920 }
3921 }
3922 }
3923 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
3924out:
3925 if (fwpkg_data)
3926 pci_free_consistent(ioc->pdev, data_length, fwpkg_data,
3927 fwpkg_data_dma);
3928 return r;
3929}
3930
3931/**
3932 * _base_display_ioc_capabilities - Disply IOC's capabilities.
3933 * @ioc: per adapter object
3934 *
3935 * Return nothing.
3936 */
3937static void
3938_base_display_ioc_capabilities(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
3939{
3940 int i = 0;
3941 char desc[16];
3942 u32 iounit_pg1_flags;
3943 u32 bios_version;
3944
3945 bios_version = le32_to_cpu(ioc->bios_pg3.BiosVersion);
3946 strncpy(desc, ioc->manu_pg0.ChipName, 16);
3947 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: FWVersion(%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d), "\
3948 "ChipRevision(0x%02x), BiosVersion(%02d.%02d.%02d.%02d)\n",
3949 ioc->name, desc,
3950 (ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0xFF000000) >> 24,
3951 (ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0x00FF0000) >> 16,
3952 (ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0x0000FF00) >> 8,
3953 ioc->facts.FWVersion.Word & 0x000000FF,
3954 ioc->pdev->revision,
3955 (bios_version & 0xFF000000) >> 24,
3956 (bios_version & 0x00FF0000) >> 16,
3957 (bios_version & 0x0000FF00) >> 8,
3958 bios_version & 0x000000FF);
3959
3960 _base_display_OEMs_branding(ioc);
3961
3962 if (ioc->facts.ProtocolFlags & MPI2_IOCFACTS_PROTOCOL_NVME_DEVICES) {
3963 pr_info("%sNVMe", i ? "," : "");
3964 i++;
3965 }
3966
3967 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "Protocol=(", ioc->name);
3968
3969 if (ioc->facts.ProtocolFlags & MPI2_IOCFACTS_PROTOCOL_SCSI_INITIATOR) {
3970 pr_info("Initiator");
3971 i++;
3972 }
3973
3974 if (ioc->facts.ProtocolFlags & MPI2_IOCFACTS_PROTOCOL_SCSI_TARGET) {
3975 pr_info("%sTarget", i ? "," : "");
3976 i++;
3977 }
3978
3979 i = 0;
3980 pr_info("), ");
3981 pr_info("Capabilities=(");
3982
3983 if (!ioc->hide_ir_msg) {
3984 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
3985 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_INTEGRATED_RAID) {
3986 pr_info("Raid");
3987 i++;
3988 }
3989 }
3990
3991 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities & MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_TLR) {
3992 pr_info("%sTLR", i ? "," : "");
3993 i++;
3994 }
3995
3996 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities & MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_MULTICAST) {
3997 pr_info("%sMulticast", i ? "," : "");
3998 i++;
3999 }
4000
4001 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
4002 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_BIDIRECTIONAL_TARGET) {
4003 pr_info("%sBIDI Target", i ? "," : "");
4004 i++;
4005 }
4006
4007 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities & MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_EEDP) {
4008 pr_info("%sEEDP", i ? "," : "");
4009 i++;
4010 }
4011
4012 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
4013 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_SNAPSHOT_BUFFER) {
4014 pr_info("%sSnapshot Buffer", i ? "," : "");
4015 i++;
4016 }
4017
4018 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
4019 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_DIAG_TRACE_BUFFER) {
4020 pr_info("%sDiag Trace Buffer", i ? "," : "");
4021 i++;
4022 }
4023
4024 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
4025 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_EXTENDED_BUFFER) {
4026 pr_info("%sDiag Extended Buffer", i ? "," : "");
4027 i++;
4028 }
4029
4030 if (ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
4031 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING) {
4032 pr_info("%sTask Set Full", i ? "," : "");
4033 i++;
4034 }
4035
4036 iounit_pg1_flags = le32_to_cpu(ioc->iounit_pg1.Flags);
4037 if (!(iounit_pg1_flags & MPI2_IOUNITPAGE1_NATIVE_COMMAND_Q_DISABLE)) {
4038 pr_info("%sNCQ", i ? "," : "");
4039 i++;
4040 }
4041
4042 pr_info(")\n");
4043}
4044
4045/**
4046 * mpt3sas_base_update_missing_delay - change the missing delay timers
4047 * @ioc: per adapter object
4048 * @device_missing_delay: amount of time till device is reported missing
4049 * @io_missing_delay: interval IO is returned when there is a missing device
4050 *
4051 * Return nothing.
4052 *
4053 * Passed on the command line, this function will modify the device missing
4054 * delay, as well as the io missing delay. This should be called at driver
4055 * load time.
4056 */
4057void
4058mpt3sas_base_update_missing_delay(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
4059 u16 device_missing_delay, u8 io_missing_delay)
4060{
4061 u16 dmd, dmd_new, dmd_orignal;
4062 u8 io_missing_delay_original;
4063 u16 sz;
4064 Mpi2SasIOUnitPage1_t *sas_iounit_pg1 = NULL;
4065 Mpi2ConfigReply_t mpi_reply;
4066 u8 num_phys = 0;
4067 u16 ioc_status;
4068
4069 mpt3sas_config_get_number_hba_phys(ioc, &num_phys);
4070 if (!num_phys)
4071 return;
4072
4073 sz = offsetof(Mpi2SasIOUnitPage1_t, PhyData) + (num_phys *
4074 sizeof(Mpi2SasIOUnit1PhyData_t));
4075 sas_iounit_pg1 = kzalloc(sz, GFP_KERNEL);
4076 if (!sas_iounit_pg1) {
4077 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "failure at %s:%d/%s()!\n",
4078 ioc->name, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__);
4079 goto out;
4080 }
4081 if ((mpt3sas_config_get_sas_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply,
4082 sas_iounit_pg1, sz))) {
4083 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "failure at %s:%d/%s()!\n",
4084 ioc->name, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__);
4085 goto out;
4086 }
4087 ioc_status = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCStatus) &
4088 MPI2_IOCSTATUS_MASK;
4089 if (ioc_status != MPI2_IOCSTATUS_SUCCESS) {
4090 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "failure at %s:%d/%s()!\n",
4091 ioc->name, __FILE__, __LINE__, __func__);
4092 goto out;
4093 }
4094
4095 /* device missing delay */
4096 dmd = sas_iounit_pg1->ReportDeviceMissingDelay;
4097 if (dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_UNIT_16)
4098 dmd = (dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK) * 16;
4099 else
4100 dmd = dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK;
4101 dmd_orignal = dmd;
4102 if (device_missing_delay > 0x7F) {
4103 dmd = (device_missing_delay > 0x7F0) ? 0x7F0 :
4104 device_missing_delay;
4105 dmd = dmd / 16;
4106 dmd |= MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_UNIT_16;
4107 } else
4108 dmd = device_missing_delay;
4109 sas_iounit_pg1->ReportDeviceMissingDelay = dmd;
4110
4111 /* io missing delay */
4112 io_missing_delay_original = sas_iounit_pg1->IODeviceMissingDelay;
4113 sas_iounit_pg1->IODeviceMissingDelay = io_missing_delay;
4114
4115 if (!mpt3sas_config_set_sas_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply, sas_iounit_pg1,
4116 sz)) {
4117 if (dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_UNIT_16)
4118 dmd_new = (dmd &
4119 MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK) * 16;
4120 else
4121 dmd_new =
4122 dmd & MPI2_SASIOUNIT1_REPORT_MISSING_TIMEOUT_MASK;
4123 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "device_missing_delay: old(%d), new(%d)\n",
4124 ioc->name, dmd_orignal, dmd_new);
4125 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "ioc_missing_delay: old(%d), new(%d)\n",
4126 ioc->name, io_missing_delay_original,
4127 io_missing_delay);
4128 ioc->device_missing_delay = dmd_new;
4129 ioc->io_missing_delay = io_missing_delay;
4130 }
4131
4132out:
4133 kfree(sas_iounit_pg1);
4134}
4135/**
4136 * _base_static_config_pages - static start of day config pages
4137 * @ioc: per adapter object
4138 *
4139 * Return nothing.
4140 */
4141static void
4142_base_static_config_pages(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
4143{
4144 Mpi2ConfigReply_t mpi_reply;
4145 u32 iounit_pg1_flags;
4146
4147 ioc->nvme_abort_timeout = 30;
4148 mpt3sas_config_get_manufacturing_pg0(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->manu_pg0);
4149 if (ioc->ir_firmware)
4150 mpt3sas_config_get_manufacturing_pg10(ioc, &mpi_reply,
4151 &ioc->manu_pg10);
4152
4153 /*
4154 * Ensure correct T10 PI operation if vendor left EEDPTagMode
4155 * flag unset in NVDATA.
4156 */
4157 mpt3sas_config_get_manufacturing_pg11(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->manu_pg11);
4158 if (ioc->manu_pg11.EEDPTagMode == 0) {
4159 pr_err("%s: overriding NVDATA EEDPTagMode setting\n",
4160 ioc->name);
4161 ioc->manu_pg11.EEDPTagMode &= ~0x3;
4162 ioc->manu_pg11.EEDPTagMode |= 0x1;
4163 mpt3sas_config_set_manufacturing_pg11(ioc, &mpi_reply,
4164 &ioc->manu_pg11);
4165 }
4166 if (ioc->manu_pg11.AddlFlags2 & NVME_TASK_MNGT_CUSTOM_MASK)
4167 ioc->tm_custom_handling = 1;
4168 else {
4169 ioc->tm_custom_handling = 0;
4170 if (ioc->manu_pg11.NVMeAbortTO < NVME_TASK_ABORT_MIN_TIMEOUT)
4171 ioc->nvme_abort_timeout = NVME_TASK_ABORT_MIN_TIMEOUT;
4172 else if (ioc->manu_pg11.NVMeAbortTO >
4173 NVME_TASK_ABORT_MAX_TIMEOUT)
4174 ioc->nvme_abort_timeout = NVME_TASK_ABORT_MAX_TIMEOUT;
4175 else
4176 ioc->nvme_abort_timeout = ioc->manu_pg11.NVMeAbortTO;
4177 }
4178
4179 mpt3sas_config_get_bios_pg2(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->bios_pg2);
4180 mpt3sas_config_get_bios_pg3(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->bios_pg3);
4181 mpt3sas_config_get_ioc_pg8(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->ioc_pg8);
4182 mpt3sas_config_get_iounit_pg0(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg0);
4183 mpt3sas_config_get_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg1);
4184 mpt3sas_config_get_iounit_pg8(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg8);
4185 _base_display_ioc_capabilities(ioc);
4186
4187 /*
4188 * Enable task_set_full handling in iounit_pg1 when the
4189 * facts capabilities indicate that its supported.
4190 */
4191 iounit_pg1_flags = le32_to_cpu(ioc->iounit_pg1.Flags);
4192 if ((ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
4193 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING))
4194 iounit_pg1_flags &=
4195 ~MPI2_IOUNITPAGE1_DISABLE_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING;
4196 else
4197 iounit_pg1_flags |=
4198 MPI2_IOUNITPAGE1_DISABLE_TASK_SET_FULL_HANDLING;
4199 ioc->iounit_pg1.Flags = cpu_to_le32(iounit_pg1_flags);
4200 mpt3sas_config_set_iounit_pg1(ioc, &mpi_reply, &ioc->iounit_pg1);
4201
4202 if (ioc->iounit_pg8.NumSensors)
4203 ioc->temp_sensors_count = ioc->iounit_pg8.NumSensors;
4204}
4205
4206/**
4207 * mpt3sas_free_enclosure_list - release memory
4208 * @ioc: per adapter object
4209 *
4210 * Free memory allocated during encloure add.
4211 *
4212 * Return nothing.
4213 */
4214void
4215mpt3sas_free_enclosure_list(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
4216{
4217 struct _enclosure_node *enclosure_dev, *enclosure_dev_next;
4218
4219 /* Free enclosure list */
4220 list_for_each_entry_safe(enclosure_dev,
4221 enclosure_dev_next, &ioc->enclosure_list, list) {
4222 list_del(&enclosure_dev->list);
4223 kfree(enclosure_dev);
4224 }
4225}
4226
4227/**
4228 * _base_release_memory_pools - release memory
4229 * @ioc: per adapter object
4230 *
4231 * Free memory allocated from _base_allocate_memory_pools.
4232 *
4233 * Return nothing.
4234 */
4235static void
4236_base_release_memory_pools(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
4237{
4238 int i = 0;
4239 int j = 0;
4240 struct chain_tracker *ct;
4241 struct reply_post_struct *rps;
4242
4243 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
4244 __func__));
4245
4246 if (ioc->request) {
4247 pci_free_consistent(ioc->pdev, ioc->request_dma_sz,
4248 ioc->request, ioc->request_dma);
4249 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4250 "request_pool(0x%p): free\n",
4251 ioc->name, ioc->request));
4252 ioc->request = NULL;
4253 }
4254
4255 if (ioc->sense) {
4256 dma_pool_free(ioc->sense_dma_pool, ioc->sense, ioc->sense_dma);
4257 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->sense_dma_pool);
4258 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4259 "sense_pool(0x%p): free\n",
4260 ioc->name, ioc->sense));
4261 ioc->sense = NULL;
4262 }
4263
4264 if (ioc->reply) {
4265 dma_pool_free(ioc->reply_dma_pool, ioc->reply, ioc->reply_dma);
4266 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->reply_dma_pool);
4267 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4268 "reply_pool(0x%p): free\n",
4269 ioc->name, ioc->reply));
4270 ioc->reply = NULL;
4271 }
4272
4273 if (ioc->reply_free) {
4274 dma_pool_free(ioc->reply_free_dma_pool, ioc->reply_free,
4275 ioc->reply_free_dma);
4276 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->reply_free_dma_pool);
4277 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4278 "reply_free_pool(0x%p): free\n",
4279 ioc->name, ioc->reply_free));
4280 ioc->reply_free = NULL;
4281 }
4282
4283 if (ioc->reply_post) {
4284 do {
4285 rps = &ioc->reply_post[i];
4286 if (rps->reply_post_free) {
4287 dma_pool_free(
4288 ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool,
4289 rps->reply_post_free,
4290 rps->reply_post_free_dma);
4291 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4292 "reply_post_free_pool(0x%p): free\n",
4293 ioc->name, rps->reply_post_free));
4294 rps->reply_post_free = NULL;
4295 }
4296 } while (ioc->rdpq_array_enable &&
4297 (++i < ioc->reply_queue_count));
4298 if (ioc->reply_post_free_array &&
4299 ioc->rdpq_array_enable) {
4300 dma_pool_free(ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma_pool,
4301 ioc->reply_post_free_array,
4302 ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma);
4303 ioc->reply_post_free_array = NULL;
4304 }
4305 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma_pool);
4306 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool);
4307 kfree(ioc->reply_post);
4308 }
4309
4310 if (ioc->pcie_sgl_dma_pool) {
4311 for (i = 0; i < ioc->scsiio_depth; i++) {
4312 dma_pool_free(ioc->pcie_sgl_dma_pool,
4313 ioc->pcie_sg_lookup[i].pcie_sgl,
4314 ioc->pcie_sg_lookup[i].pcie_sgl_dma);
4315 }
4316 if (ioc->pcie_sgl_dma_pool)
4317 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->pcie_sgl_dma_pool);
4318 }
4319
4320 if (ioc->config_page) {
4321 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4322 "config_page(0x%p): free\n", ioc->name,
4323 ioc->config_page));
4324 pci_free_consistent(ioc->pdev, ioc->config_page_sz,
4325 ioc->config_page, ioc->config_page_dma);
4326 }
4327
4328 kfree(ioc->hpr_lookup);
4329 kfree(ioc->internal_lookup);
4330 if (ioc->chain_lookup) {
4331 for (i = 0; i < ioc->scsiio_depth; i++) {
4332 for (j = ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer;
4333 j < ioc->chains_needed_per_io; j++) {
4334 ct = &ioc->chain_lookup[i].chains_per_smid[j];
4335 if (ct && ct->chain_buffer)
4336 dma_pool_free(ioc->chain_dma_pool,
4337 ct->chain_buffer,
4338 ct->chain_buffer_dma);
4339 }
4340 kfree(ioc->chain_lookup[i].chains_per_smid);
4341 }
4342 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->chain_dma_pool);
4343 kfree(ioc->chain_lookup);
4344 ioc->chain_lookup = NULL;
4345 }
4346}
4347
4348/**
4349 * is_MSB_are_same - checks whether all reply queues in a set are
4350 * having same upper 32bits in their base memory address.
4351 * @reply_pool_start_address: Base address of a reply queue set
4352 * @pool_sz: Size of single Reply Descriptor Post Queues pool size
4353 *
4354 * Returns 1 if reply queues in a set have a same upper 32bits
4355 * in their base memory address,
4356 * else 0
4357 */
4358
4359static int
4360is_MSB_are_same(long reply_pool_start_address, u32 pool_sz)
4361{
4362 long reply_pool_end_address;
4363
4364 reply_pool_end_address = reply_pool_start_address + pool_sz;
4365
4366 if (upper_32_bits(reply_pool_start_address) ==
4367 upper_32_bits(reply_pool_end_address))
4368 return 1;
4369 else
4370 return 0;
4371}
4372
4373/**
4374 * _base_allocate_memory_pools - allocate start of day memory pools
4375 * @ioc: per adapter object
4376 *
4377 * Returns 0 success, anything else error
4378 */
4379static int
4380_base_allocate_memory_pools(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
4381{
4382 struct mpt3sas_facts *facts;
4383 u16 max_sge_elements;
4384 u16 chains_needed_per_io;
4385 u32 sz, total_sz, reply_post_free_sz, reply_post_free_array_sz;
4386 u32 retry_sz;
4387 u16 max_request_credit, nvme_blocks_needed;
4388 unsigned short sg_tablesize;
4389 u16 sge_size;
4390 int i, j;
4391 struct chain_tracker *ct;
4392
4393 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
4394 __func__));
4395
4396
4397 retry_sz = 0;
4398 facts = &ioc->facts;
4399
4400 /* command line tunables for max sgl entries */
4401 if (max_sgl_entries != -1)
4402 sg_tablesize = max_sgl_entries;
4403 else {
4404 if (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged == MPI2_VERSION)
4405 sg_tablesize = MPT2SAS_SG_DEPTH;
4406 else
4407 sg_tablesize = MPT3SAS_SG_DEPTH;
4408 }
4409
4410 /* max sgl entries <= MPT_KDUMP_MIN_PHYS_SEGMENTS in KDUMP mode */
4411 if (reset_devices)
4412 sg_tablesize = min_t(unsigned short, sg_tablesize,
4413 MPT_KDUMP_MIN_PHYS_SEGMENTS);
4414
4415 if (ioc->is_mcpu_endpoint)
4416 ioc->shost->sg_tablesize = MPT_MIN_PHYS_SEGMENTS;
4417 else {
4418 if (sg_tablesize < MPT_MIN_PHYS_SEGMENTS)
4419 sg_tablesize = MPT_MIN_PHYS_SEGMENTS;
4420 else if (sg_tablesize > MPT_MAX_PHYS_SEGMENTS) {
4421 sg_tablesize = min_t(unsigned short, sg_tablesize,
4422 SG_MAX_SEGMENTS);
4423 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT
4424 "sg_tablesize(%u) is bigger than kernel "
4425 "defined SG_CHUNK_SIZE(%u)\n", ioc->name,
4426 sg_tablesize, MPT_MAX_PHYS_SEGMENTS);
4427 }
4428 ioc->shost->sg_tablesize = sg_tablesize;
4429 }
4430
4431 ioc->internal_depth = min_t(int, (facts->HighPriorityCredit + (5)),
4432 (facts->RequestCredit / 4));
4433 if (ioc->internal_depth < INTERNAL_CMDS_COUNT) {
4434 if (facts->RequestCredit <= (INTERNAL_CMDS_COUNT +
4435 INTERNAL_SCSIIO_CMDS_COUNT)) {
4436 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "IOC doesn't have enough Request \
4437 Credits, it has just %d number of credits\n",
4438 ioc->name, facts->RequestCredit);
4439 return -ENOMEM;
4440 }
4441 ioc->internal_depth = 10;
4442 }
4443
4444 ioc->hi_priority_depth = ioc->internal_depth - (5);
4445 /* command line tunables for max controller queue depth */
4446 if (max_queue_depth != -1 && max_queue_depth != 0) {
4447 max_request_credit = min_t(u16, max_queue_depth +
4448 ioc->internal_depth, facts->RequestCredit);
4449 if (max_request_credit > MAX_HBA_QUEUE_DEPTH)
4450 max_request_credit = MAX_HBA_QUEUE_DEPTH;
4451 } else if (reset_devices)
4452 max_request_credit = min_t(u16, facts->RequestCredit,
4453 (MPT3SAS_KDUMP_SCSI_IO_DEPTH + ioc->internal_depth));
4454 else
4455 max_request_credit = min_t(u16, facts->RequestCredit,
4456 MAX_HBA_QUEUE_DEPTH);
4457
4458 /* Firmware maintains additional facts->HighPriorityCredit number of
4459 * credits for HiPriprity Request messages, so hba queue depth will be
4460 * sum of max_request_credit and high priority queue depth.
4461 */
4462 ioc->hba_queue_depth = max_request_credit + ioc->hi_priority_depth;
4463
4464 /* request frame size */
4465 ioc->request_sz = facts->IOCRequestFrameSize * 4;
4466
4467 /* reply frame size */
4468 ioc->reply_sz = facts->ReplyFrameSize * 4;
4469
4470 /* chain segment size */
4471 if (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged != MPI2_VERSION) {
4472 if (facts->IOCMaxChainSegmentSize)
4473 ioc->chain_segment_sz =
4474 facts->IOCMaxChainSegmentSize *
4475 MAX_CHAIN_ELEMT_SZ;
4476 else
4477 /* set to 128 bytes size if IOCMaxChainSegmentSize is zero */
4478 ioc->chain_segment_sz = DEFAULT_NUM_FWCHAIN_ELEMTS *
4479 MAX_CHAIN_ELEMT_SZ;
4480 } else
4481 ioc->chain_segment_sz = ioc->request_sz;
4482
4483 /* calculate the max scatter element size */
4484 sge_size = max_t(u16, ioc->sge_size, ioc->sge_size_ieee);
4485
4486 retry_allocation:
4487 total_sz = 0;
4488 /* calculate number of sg elements left over in the 1st frame */
4489 max_sge_elements = ioc->request_sz - ((sizeof(Mpi2SCSIIORequest_t) -
4490 sizeof(Mpi2SGEIOUnion_t)) + sge_size);
4491 ioc->max_sges_in_main_message = max_sge_elements/sge_size;
4492
4493 /* now do the same for a chain buffer */
4494 max_sge_elements = ioc->chain_segment_sz - sge_size;
4495 ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message = max_sge_elements/sge_size;
4496
4497 /*
4498 * MPT3SAS_SG_DEPTH = CONFIG_FUSION_MAX_SGE
4499 */
4500 chains_needed_per_io = ((ioc->shost->sg_tablesize -
4501 ioc->max_sges_in_main_message)/ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message)
4502 + 1;
4503 if (chains_needed_per_io > facts->MaxChainDepth) {
4504 chains_needed_per_io = facts->MaxChainDepth;
4505 ioc->shost->sg_tablesize = min_t(u16,
4506 ioc->max_sges_in_main_message + (ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message
4507 * chains_needed_per_io), ioc->shost->sg_tablesize);
4508 }
4509 ioc->chains_needed_per_io = chains_needed_per_io;
4510
4511 /* reply free queue sizing - taking into account for 64 FW events */
4512 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth + 64;
4513
4514 /* mCPU manage single counters for simplicity */
4515 if (ioc->is_mcpu_endpoint)
4516 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth = ioc->reply_free_queue_depth;
4517 else {
4518 /* calculate reply descriptor post queue depth */
4519 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth +
4520 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth + 1;
4521 /* align the reply post queue on the next 16 count boundary */
4522 if (ioc->reply_post_queue_depth % 16)
4523 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth += 16 -
4524 (ioc->reply_post_queue_depth % 16);
4525 }
4526
4527 if (ioc->reply_post_queue_depth >
4528 facts->MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth) {
4529 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth =
4530 facts->MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth -
4531 (facts->MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth % 16);
4532 ioc->hba_queue_depth =
4533 ((ioc->reply_post_queue_depth - 64) / 2) - 1;
4534 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth + 64;
4535 }
4536
4537 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "scatter gather: " \
4538 "sge_in_main_msg(%d), sge_per_chain(%d), sge_per_io(%d), "
4539 "chains_per_io(%d)\n", ioc->name, ioc->max_sges_in_main_message,
4540 ioc->max_sges_in_chain_message, ioc->shost->sg_tablesize,
4541 ioc->chains_needed_per_io));
4542
4543 /* reply post queue, 16 byte align */
4544 reply_post_free_sz = ioc->reply_post_queue_depth *
4545 sizeof(Mpi2DefaultReplyDescriptor_t);
4546
4547 sz = reply_post_free_sz;
4548 if (_base_is_controller_msix_enabled(ioc) && !ioc->rdpq_array_enable)
4549 sz *= ioc->reply_queue_count;
4550
4551 ioc->reply_post = kcalloc((ioc->rdpq_array_enable) ?
4552 (ioc->reply_queue_count):1,
4553 sizeof(struct reply_post_struct), GFP_KERNEL);
4554
4555 if (!ioc->reply_post) {
4556 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_post_free pool: kcalloc failed\n",
4557 ioc->name);
4558 goto out;
4559 }
4560 ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("reply_post_free pool",
4561 &ioc->pdev->dev, sz, 16, 0);
4562 if (!ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool) {
4563 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4564 "reply_post_free pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
4565 ioc->name);
4566 goto out;
4567 }
4568 i = 0;
4569 do {
4570 ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free =
4571 dma_pool_alloc(ioc->reply_post_free_dma_pool,
4572 GFP_KERNEL,
4573 &ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free_dma);
4574 if (!ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free) {
4575 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4576 "reply_post_free pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
4577 ioc->name);
4578 goto out;
4579 }
4580 memset(ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free, 0, sz);
4581 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4582 "reply post free pool (0x%p): depth(%d),"
4583 "element_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n", ioc->name,
4584 ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free,
4585 ioc->reply_post_queue_depth, 8, sz/1024));
4586 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4587 "reply_post_free_dma = (0x%llx)\n", ioc->name,
4588 (unsigned long long)
4589 ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free_dma));
4590 total_sz += sz;
4591 } while (ioc->rdpq_array_enable && (++i < ioc->reply_queue_count));
4592
4593 if (ioc->dma_mask == 64) {
4594 if (_base_change_consistent_dma_mask(ioc, ioc->pdev) != 0) {
4595 pr_warn(MPT3SAS_FMT
4596 "no suitable consistent DMA mask for %s\n",
4597 ioc->name, pci_name(ioc->pdev));
4598 goto out;
4599 }
4600 }
4601
4602 ioc->scsiio_depth = ioc->hba_queue_depth -
4603 ioc->hi_priority_depth - ioc->internal_depth;
4604
4605 /* set the scsi host can_queue depth
4606 * with some internal commands that could be outstanding
4607 */
4608 ioc->shost->can_queue = ioc->scsiio_depth - INTERNAL_SCSIIO_CMDS_COUNT;
4609 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4610 "scsi host: can_queue depth (%d)\n",
4611 ioc->name, ioc->shost->can_queue));
4612
4613
4614 /* contiguous pool for request and chains, 16 byte align, one extra "
4615 * "frame for smid=0
4616 */
4617 ioc->chain_depth = ioc->chains_needed_per_io * ioc->scsiio_depth;
4618 sz = ((ioc->scsiio_depth + 1) * ioc->request_sz);
4619
4620 /* hi-priority queue */
4621 sz += (ioc->hi_priority_depth * ioc->request_sz);
4622
4623 /* internal queue */
4624 sz += (ioc->internal_depth * ioc->request_sz);
4625
4626 ioc->request_dma_sz = sz;
4627 ioc->request = pci_alloc_consistent(ioc->pdev, sz, &ioc->request_dma);
4628 if (!ioc->request) {
4629 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "request pool: pci_alloc_consistent " \
4630 "failed: hba_depth(%d), chains_per_io(%d), frame_sz(%d), "
4631 "total(%d kB)\n", ioc->name, ioc->hba_queue_depth,
4632 ioc->chains_needed_per_io, ioc->request_sz, sz/1024);
4633 if (ioc->scsiio_depth < MPT3SAS_SAS_QUEUE_DEPTH)
4634 goto out;
4635 retry_sz = 64;
4636 ioc->hba_queue_depth -= retry_sz;
4637 _base_release_memory_pools(ioc);
4638 goto retry_allocation;
4639 }
4640
4641 if (retry_sz)
4642 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "request pool: pci_alloc_consistent " \
4643 "succeed: hba_depth(%d), chains_per_io(%d), frame_sz(%d), "
4644 "total(%d kb)\n", ioc->name, ioc->hba_queue_depth,
4645 ioc->chains_needed_per_io, ioc->request_sz, sz/1024);
4646
4647 /* hi-priority queue */
4648 ioc->hi_priority = ioc->request + ((ioc->scsiio_depth + 1) *
4649 ioc->request_sz);
4650 ioc->hi_priority_dma = ioc->request_dma + ((ioc->scsiio_depth + 1) *
4651 ioc->request_sz);
4652
4653 /* internal queue */
4654 ioc->internal = ioc->hi_priority + (ioc->hi_priority_depth *
4655 ioc->request_sz);
4656 ioc->internal_dma = ioc->hi_priority_dma + (ioc->hi_priority_depth *
4657 ioc->request_sz);
4658
4659 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4660 "request pool(0x%p): depth(%d), frame_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n",
4661 ioc->name, ioc->request, ioc->hba_queue_depth, ioc->request_sz,
4662 (ioc->hba_queue_depth * ioc->request_sz)/1024));
4663
4664 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "request pool: dma(0x%llx)\n",
4665 ioc->name, (unsigned long long) ioc->request_dma));
4666 total_sz += sz;
4667
4668 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "scsiio(0x%p): depth(%d)\n",
4669 ioc->name, ioc->request, ioc->scsiio_depth));
4670
4671 ioc->chain_depth = min_t(u32, ioc->chain_depth, MAX_CHAIN_DEPTH);
4672 sz = ioc->scsiio_depth * sizeof(struct chain_lookup);
4673 ioc->chain_lookup = kzalloc(sz, GFP_KERNEL);
4674 if (!ioc->chain_lookup) {
4675 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "chain_lookup: __get_free_pages "
4676 "failed\n", ioc->name);
4677 goto out;
4678 }
4679
4680 sz = ioc->chains_needed_per_io * sizeof(struct chain_tracker);
4681 for (i = 0; i < ioc->scsiio_depth; i++) {
4682 ioc->chain_lookup[i].chains_per_smid = kzalloc(sz, GFP_KERNEL);
4683 if (!ioc->chain_lookup[i].chains_per_smid) {
4684 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "chain_lookup: "
4685 " kzalloc failed\n", ioc->name);
4686 goto out;
4687 }
4688 }
4689
4690 /* initialize hi-priority queue smid's */
4691 ioc->hpr_lookup = kcalloc(ioc->hi_priority_depth,
4692 sizeof(struct request_tracker), GFP_KERNEL);
4693 if (!ioc->hpr_lookup) {
4694 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "hpr_lookup: kcalloc failed\n",
4695 ioc->name);
4696 goto out;
4697 }
4698 ioc->hi_priority_smid = ioc->scsiio_depth + 1;
4699 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4700 "hi_priority(0x%p): depth(%d), start smid(%d)\n",
4701 ioc->name, ioc->hi_priority,
4702 ioc->hi_priority_depth, ioc->hi_priority_smid));
4703
4704 /* initialize internal queue smid's */
4705 ioc->internal_lookup = kcalloc(ioc->internal_depth,
4706 sizeof(struct request_tracker), GFP_KERNEL);
4707 if (!ioc->internal_lookup) {
4708 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "internal_lookup: kcalloc failed\n",
4709 ioc->name);
4710 goto out;
4711 }
4712 ioc->internal_smid = ioc->hi_priority_smid + ioc->hi_priority_depth;
4713 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4714 "internal(0x%p): depth(%d), start smid(%d)\n",
4715 ioc->name, ioc->internal,
4716 ioc->internal_depth, ioc->internal_smid));
4717 /*
4718 * The number of NVMe page sized blocks needed is:
4719 * (((sg_tablesize * 8) - 1) / (page_size - 8)) + 1
4720 * ((sg_tablesize * 8) - 1) is the max PRP's minus the first PRP entry
4721 * that is placed in the main message frame. 8 is the size of each PRP
4722 * entry or PRP list pointer entry. 8 is subtracted from page_size
4723 * because of the PRP list pointer entry at the end of a page, so this
4724 * is not counted as a PRP entry. The 1 added page is a round up.
4725 *
4726 * To avoid allocation failures due to the amount of memory that could
4727 * be required for NVMe PRP's, only each set of NVMe blocks will be
4728 * contiguous, so a new set is allocated for each possible I/O.
4729 */
4730 ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer = 0;
4731 if (ioc->facts.ProtocolFlags & MPI2_IOCFACTS_PROTOCOL_NVME_DEVICES) {
4732 nvme_blocks_needed =
4733 (ioc->shost->sg_tablesize * NVME_PRP_SIZE) - 1;
4734 nvme_blocks_needed /= (ioc->page_size - NVME_PRP_SIZE);
4735 nvme_blocks_needed++;
4736
4737 sz = sizeof(struct pcie_sg_list) * ioc->scsiio_depth;
4738 ioc->pcie_sg_lookup = kzalloc(sz, GFP_KERNEL);
4739 if (!ioc->pcie_sg_lookup) {
4740 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4741 "PCIe SGL lookup: kzalloc failed\n", ioc->name);
4742 goto out;
4743 }
4744 sz = nvme_blocks_needed * ioc->page_size;
4745 ioc->pcie_sgl_dma_pool =
4746 dma_pool_create("PCIe SGL pool", &ioc->pdev->dev, sz, 16, 0);
4747 if (!ioc->pcie_sgl_dma_pool) {
4748 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4749 "PCIe SGL pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
4750 ioc->name);
4751 goto out;
4752 }
4753
4754 ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer = sz/ioc->chain_segment_sz;
4755 ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer = min(ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer,
4756 ioc->chains_needed_per_io);
4757
4758 for (i = 0; i < ioc->scsiio_depth; i++) {
4759 ioc->pcie_sg_lookup[i].pcie_sgl = dma_pool_alloc(
4760 ioc->pcie_sgl_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
4761 &ioc->pcie_sg_lookup[i].pcie_sgl_dma);
4762 if (!ioc->pcie_sg_lookup[i].pcie_sgl) {
4763 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4764 "PCIe SGL pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
4765 ioc->name);
4766 goto out;
4767 }
4768 for (j = 0; j < ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer; j++) {
4769 ct = &ioc->chain_lookup[i].chains_per_smid[j];
4770 ct->chain_buffer =
4771 ioc->pcie_sg_lookup[i].pcie_sgl +
4772 (j * ioc->chain_segment_sz);
4773 ct->chain_buffer_dma =
4774 ioc->pcie_sg_lookup[i].pcie_sgl_dma +
4775 (j * ioc->chain_segment_sz);
4776 }
4777 }
4778
4779 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "PCIe sgl pool depth(%d), "
4780 "element_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n", ioc->name,
4781 ioc->scsiio_depth, sz, (sz * ioc->scsiio_depth)/1024));
4782 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "Number of chains can "
4783 "fit in a PRP page(%d)\n", ioc->name,
4784 ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer));
4785 total_sz += sz * ioc->scsiio_depth;
4786 }
4787
4788 ioc->chain_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("chain pool", &ioc->pdev->dev,
4789 ioc->chain_segment_sz, 16, 0);
4790 if (!ioc->chain_dma_pool) {
4791 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "chain_dma_pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
4792 ioc->name);
4793 goto out;
4794 }
4795 for (i = 0; i < ioc->scsiio_depth; i++) {
4796 for (j = ioc->chains_per_prp_buffer;
4797 j < ioc->chains_needed_per_io; j++) {
4798 ct = &ioc->chain_lookup[i].chains_per_smid[j];
4799 ct->chain_buffer = dma_pool_alloc(
4800 ioc->chain_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
4801 &ct->chain_buffer_dma);
4802 if (!ct->chain_buffer) {
4803 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "chain_lookup: "
4804 " pci_pool_alloc failed\n", ioc->name);
4805 _base_release_memory_pools(ioc);
4806 goto out;
4807 }
4808 }
4809 total_sz += ioc->chain_segment_sz;
4810 }
4811
4812 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4813 "chain pool depth(%d), frame_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n",
4814 ioc->name, ioc->chain_depth, ioc->chain_segment_sz,
4815 ((ioc->chain_depth * ioc->chain_segment_sz))/1024));
4816
4817 /* sense buffers, 4 byte align */
4818 sz = ioc->scsiio_depth * SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE;
4819 ioc->sense_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("sense pool", &ioc->pdev->dev, sz,
4820 4, 0);
4821 if (!ioc->sense_dma_pool) {
4822 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
4823 ioc->name);
4824 goto out;
4825 }
4826 ioc->sense = dma_pool_alloc(ioc->sense_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
4827 &ioc->sense_dma);
4828 if (!ioc->sense) {
4829 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
4830 ioc->name);
4831 goto out;
4832 }
4833 /* sense buffer requires to be in same 4 gb region.
4834 * Below function will check the same.
4835 * In case of failure, new pci pool will be created with updated
4836 * alignment. Older allocation and pool will be destroyed.
4837 * Alignment will be used such a way that next allocation if
4838 * success, will always meet same 4gb region requirement.
4839 * Actual requirement is not alignment, but we need start and end of
4840 * DMA address must have same upper 32 bit address.
4841 */
4842 if (!is_MSB_are_same((long)ioc->sense, sz)) {
4843 //Release Sense pool & Reallocate
4844 dma_pool_free(ioc->sense_dma_pool, ioc->sense, ioc->sense_dma);
4845 dma_pool_destroy(ioc->sense_dma_pool);
4846 ioc->sense = NULL;
4847
4848 ioc->sense_dma_pool =
4849 dma_pool_create("sense pool", &ioc->pdev->dev, sz,
4850 roundup_pow_of_two(sz), 0);
4851 if (!ioc->sense_dma_pool) {
4852 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense pool: pci_pool_create failed\n",
4853 ioc->name);
4854 goto out;
4855 }
4856 ioc->sense = dma_pool_alloc(ioc->sense_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
4857 &ioc->sense_dma);
4858 if (!ioc->sense) {
4859 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense pool: pci_pool_alloc failed\n",
4860 ioc->name);
4861 goto out;
4862 }
4863 }
4864 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4865 "sense pool(0x%p): depth(%d), element_size(%d), pool_size"
4866 "(%d kB)\n", ioc->name, ioc->sense, ioc->scsiio_depth,
4867 SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE, sz/1024));
4868 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "sense_dma(0x%llx)\n",
4869 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->sense_dma));
4870 total_sz += sz;
4871
4872 /* reply pool, 4 byte align */
4873 sz = ioc->reply_free_queue_depth * ioc->reply_sz;
4874 ioc->reply_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("reply pool", &ioc->pdev->dev, sz,
4875 4, 0);
4876 if (!ioc->reply_dma_pool) {
4877 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
4878 ioc->name);
4879 goto out;
4880 }
4881 ioc->reply = dma_pool_alloc(ioc->reply_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
4882 &ioc->reply_dma);
4883 if (!ioc->reply) {
4884 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
4885 ioc->name);
4886 goto out;
4887 }
4888 ioc->reply_dma_min_address = (u32)(ioc->reply_dma);
4889 ioc->reply_dma_max_address = (u32)(ioc->reply_dma) + sz;
4890 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4891 "reply pool(0x%p): depth(%d), frame_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n",
4892 ioc->name, ioc->reply,
4893 ioc->reply_free_queue_depth, ioc->reply_sz, sz/1024));
4894 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_dma(0x%llx)\n",
4895 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->reply_dma));
4896 total_sz += sz;
4897
4898 /* reply free queue, 16 byte align */
4899 sz = ioc->reply_free_queue_depth * 4;
4900 ioc->reply_free_dma_pool = dma_pool_create("reply_free pool",
4901 &ioc->pdev->dev, sz, 16, 0);
4902 if (!ioc->reply_free_dma_pool) {
4903 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_free pool: dma_pool_create failed\n",
4904 ioc->name);
4905 goto out;
4906 }
4907 ioc->reply_free = dma_pool_alloc(ioc->reply_free_dma_pool, GFP_KERNEL,
4908 &ioc->reply_free_dma);
4909 if (!ioc->reply_free) {
4910 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_free pool: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
4911 ioc->name);
4912 goto out;
4913 }
4914 memset(ioc->reply_free, 0, sz);
4915 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_free pool(0x%p): " \
4916 "depth(%d), element_size(%d), pool_size(%d kB)\n", ioc->name,
4917 ioc->reply_free, ioc->reply_free_queue_depth, 4, sz/1024));
4918 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4919 "reply_free_dma (0x%llx)\n",
4920 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->reply_free_dma));
4921 total_sz += sz;
4922
4923 if (ioc->rdpq_array_enable) {
4924 reply_post_free_array_sz = ioc->reply_queue_count *
4925 sizeof(Mpi2IOCInitRDPQArrayEntry);
4926 ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma_pool =
4927 dma_pool_create("reply_post_free_array pool",
4928 &ioc->pdev->dev, reply_post_free_array_sz, 16, 0);
4929 if (!ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma_pool) {
4930 dinitprintk(ioc,
4931 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_post_free_array pool: "
4932 "dma_pool_create failed\n", ioc->name));
4933 goto out;
4934 }
4935 ioc->reply_post_free_array =
4936 dma_pool_alloc(ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma_pool,
4937 GFP_KERNEL, &ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma);
4938 if (!ioc->reply_post_free_array) {
4939 dinitprintk(ioc,
4940 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "reply_post_free_array pool: "
4941 "dma_pool_alloc failed\n", ioc->name));
4942 goto out;
4943 }
4944 }
4945 ioc->config_page_sz = 512;
4946 ioc->config_page = pci_alloc_consistent(ioc->pdev,
4947 ioc->config_page_sz, &ioc->config_page_dma);
4948 if (!ioc->config_page) {
4949 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
4950 "config page: dma_pool_alloc failed\n",
4951 ioc->name);
4952 goto out;
4953 }
4954 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4955 "config page(0x%p): size(%d)\n",
4956 ioc->name, ioc->config_page, ioc->config_page_sz));
4957 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "config_page_dma(0x%llx)\n",
4958 ioc->name, (unsigned long long)ioc->config_page_dma));
4959 total_sz += ioc->config_page_sz;
4960
4961 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "Allocated physical memory: size(%d kB)\n",
4962 ioc->name, total_sz/1024);
4963 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
4964 "Current Controller Queue Depth(%d),Max Controller Queue Depth(%d)\n",
4965 ioc->name, ioc->shost->can_queue, facts->RequestCredit);
4966 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "Scatter Gather Elements per IO(%d)\n",
4967 ioc->name, ioc->shost->sg_tablesize);
4968 return 0;
4969
4970 out:
4971 return -ENOMEM;
4972}
4973
4974/**
4975 * mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate - Get the current state of a MPT adapter.
4976 * @ioc: Pointer to MPT_ADAPTER structure
4977 * @cooked: Request raw or cooked IOC state
4978 *
4979 * Returns all IOC Doorbell register bits if cooked==0, else just the
4980 * Doorbell bits in MPI_IOC_STATE_MASK.
4981 */
4982u32
4983mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int cooked)
4984{
4985 u32 s, sc;
4986
4987 s = readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
4988 sc = s & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK;
4989 return cooked ? sc : s;
4990}
4991
4992/**
4993 * _base_wait_on_iocstate - waiting on a particular ioc state
4994 * @ioc_state: controller state { READY, OPERATIONAL, or RESET }
4995 * @timeout: timeout in second
4996 *
4997 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
4998 */
4999static int
5000_base_wait_on_iocstate(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u32 ioc_state, int timeout)
5001{
5002 u32 count, cntdn;
5003 u32 current_state;
5004
5005 count = 0;
5006 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
5007 do {
5008 current_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
5009 if (current_state == ioc_state)
5010 return 0;
5011 if (count && current_state == MPI2_IOC_STATE_FAULT)
5012 break;
5013
5014 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
5015 count++;
5016 } while (--cntdn);
5017
5018 return current_state;
5019}
5020
5021/**
5022 * _base_wait_for_doorbell_int - waiting for controller interrupt(generated by
5023 * a write to the doorbell)
5024 * @ioc: per adapter object
5025 * @timeout: timeout in second
5026 *
5027 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5028 *
5029 * Notes: MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS - set to one when IOC writes to doorbell.
5030 */
5031static int
5032_base_diag_reset(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc);
5033
5034static int
5035_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
5036{
5037 u32 cntdn, count;
5038 u32 int_status;
5039
5040 count = 0;
5041 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
5042 do {
5043 int_status = readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5044 if (int_status & MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS) {
5045 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5046 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
5047 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
5048 return 0;
5049 }
5050
5051 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
5052 count++;
5053 } while (--cntdn);
5054
5055 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5056 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), int_status(%x)!\n",
5057 ioc->name, __func__, count, int_status);
5058 return -EFAULT;
5059}
5060
5061static int
5062_base_spin_on_doorbell_int(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
5063{
5064 u32 cntdn, count;
5065 u32 int_status;
5066
5067 count = 0;
5068 cntdn = 2000 * timeout;
5069 do {
5070 int_status = readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5071 if (int_status & MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS) {
5072 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5073 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
5074 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
5075 return 0;
5076 }
5077
5078 udelay(500);
5079 count++;
5080 } while (--cntdn);
5081
5082 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5083 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), int_status(%x)!\n",
5084 ioc->name, __func__, count, int_status);
5085 return -EFAULT;
5086
5087}
5088
5089/**
5090 * _base_wait_for_doorbell_ack - waiting for controller to read the doorbell.
5091 * @ioc: per adapter object
5092 * @timeout: timeout in second
5093 *
5094 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5095 *
5096 * Notes: MPI2_HIS_SYS2IOC_DB_STATUS - set to one when host writes to
5097 * doorbell.
5098 */
5099static int
5100_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
5101{
5102 u32 cntdn, count;
5103 u32 int_status;
5104 u32 doorbell;
5105
5106 count = 0;
5107 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
5108 do {
5109 int_status = readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5110 if (!(int_status & MPI2_HIS_SYS2IOC_DB_STATUS)) {
5111 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5112 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
5113 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
5114 return 0;
5115 } else if (int_status & MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS) {
5116 doorbell = readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
5117 if ((doorbell & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) ==
5118 MPI2_IOC_STATE_FAULT) {
5119 mpt3sas_base_fault_info(ioc , doorbell);
5120 return -EFAULT;
5121 }
5122 } else if (int_status == 0xFFFFFFFF)
5123 goto out;
5124
5125 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
5126 count++;
5127 } while (--cntdn);
5128
5129 out:
5130 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5131 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), int_status(%x)!\n",
5132 ioc->name, __func__, count, int_status);
5133 return -EFAULT;
5134}
5135
5136/**
5137 * _base_wait_for_doorbell_not_used - waiting for doorbell to not be in use
5138 * @ioc: per adapter object
5139 * @timeout: timeout in second
5140 *
5141 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5142 *
5143 */
5144static int
5145_base_wait_for_doorbell_not_used(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
5146{
5147 u32 cntdn, count;
5148 u32 doorbell_reg;
5149
5150 count = 0;
5151 cntdn = 1000 * timeout;
5152 do {
5153 doorbell_reg = readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
5154 if (!(doorbell_reg & MPI2_DOORBELL_USED)) {
5155 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5156 "%s: successful count(%d), timeout(%d)\n",
5157 ioc->name, __func__, count, timeout));
5158 return 0;
5159 }
5160
5161 usleep_range(1000, 1500);
5162 count++;
5163 } while (--cntdn);
5164
5165 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5166 "%s: failed due to timeout count(%d), doorbell_reg(%x)!\n",
5167 ioc->name, __func__, count, doorbell_reg);
5168 return -EFAULT;
5169}
5170
5171/**
5172 * _base_send_ioc_reset - send doorbell reset
5173 * @ioc: per adapter object
5174 * @reset_type: currently only supports: MPI2_FUNCTION_IOC_MESSAGE_UNIT_RESET
5175 * @timeout: timeout in second
5176 *
5177 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5178 */
5179static int
5180_base_send_ioc_reset(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u8 reset_type, int timeout)
5181{
5182 u32 ioc_state;
5183 int r = 0;
5184
5185 if (reset_type != MPI2_FUNCTION_IOC_MESSAGE_UNIT_RESET) {
5186 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: unknown reset_type\n",
5187 ioc->name, __func__);
5188 return -EFAULT;
5189 }
5190
5191 if (!(ioc->facts.IOCCapabilities &
5192 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_EVENT_REPLAY))
5193 return -EFAULT;
5194
5195 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "sending message unit reset !!\n", ioc->name);
5196
5197 writel(reset_type << MPI2_DOORBELL_FUNCTION_SHIFT,
5198 &ioc->chip->Doorbell);
5199 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(ioc, 15))) {
5200 r = -EFAULT;
5201 goto out;
5202 }
5203 ioc_state = _base_wait_on_iocstate(ioc, MPI2_IOC_STATE_READY, timeout);
5204 if (ioc_state) {
5205 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5206 "%s: failed going to ready state (ioc_state=0x%x)\n",
5207 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_state);
5208 r = -EFAULT;
5209 goto out;
5210 }
5211 out:
5212 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "message unit reset: %s\n",
5213 ioc->name, ((r == 0) ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));
5214 return r;
5215}
5216
5217/**
5218 * _base_handshake_req_reply_wait - send request thru doorbell interface
5219 * @ioc: per adapter object
5220 * @request_bytes: request length
5221 * @request: pointer having request payload
5222 * @reply_bytes: reply length
5223 * @reply: pointer to reply payload
5224 * @timeout: timeout in second
5225 *
5226 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5227 */
5228static int
5229_base_handshake_req_reply_wait(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int request_bytes,
5230 u32 *request, int reply_bytes, u16 *reply, int timeout)
5231{
5232 MPI2DefaultReply_t *default_reply = (MPI2DefaultReply_t *)reply;
5233 int i;
5234 u8 failed;
5235 __le32 *mfp;
5236
5237 /* make sure doorbell is not in use */
5238 if ((readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell) & MPI2_DOORBELL_USED)) {
5239 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5240 "doorbell is in use (line=%d)\n",
5241 ioc->name, __LINE__);
5242 return -EFAULT;
5243 }
5244
5245 /* clear pending doorbell interrupts from previous state changes */
5246 if (readl(&ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus) &
5247 MPI2_HIS_IOC2SYS_DB_STATUS)
5248 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5249
5250 /* send message to ioc */
5251 writel(((MPI2_FUNCTION_HANDSHAKE<<MPI2_DOORBELL_FUNCTION_SHIFT) |
5252 ((request_bytes/4)<<MPI2_DOORBELL_ADD_DWORDS_SHIFT)),
5253 &ioc->chip->Doorbell);
5254
5255 if ((_base_spin_on_doorbell_int(ioc, 5))) {
5256 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5257 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
5258 ioc->name, __LINE__);
5259 return -EFAULT;
5260 }
5261 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5262
5263 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(ioc, 5))) {
5264 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5265 "doorbell handshake ack failed (line=%d)\n",
5266 ioc->name, __LINE__);
5267 return -EFAULT;
5268 }
5269
5270 /* send message 32-bits at a time */
5271 for (i = 0, failed = 0; i < request_bytes/4 && !failed; i++) {
5272 writel(cpu_to_le32(request[i]), &ioc->chip->Doorbell);
5273 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_ack(ioc, 5)))
5274 failed = 1;
5275 }
5276
5277 if (failed) {
5278 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5279 "doorbell handshake sending request failed (line=%d)\n",
5280 ioc->name, __LINE__);
5281 return -EFAULT;
5282 }
5283
5284 /* now wait for the reply */
5285 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, timeout))) {
5286 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5287 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
5288 ioc->name, __LINE__);
5289 return -EFAULT;
5290 }
5291
5292 /* read the first two 16-bits, it gives the total length of the reply */
5293 reply[0] = le16_to_cpu(readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell)
5294 & MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
5295 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5296 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, 5))) {
5297 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5298 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
5299 ioc->name, __LINE__);
5300 return -EFAULT;
5301 }
5302 reply[1] = le16_to_cpu(readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell)
5303 & MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
5304 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5305
5306 for (i = 2; i < default_reply->MsgLength * 2; i++) {
5307 if ((_base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, 5))) {
5308 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5309 "doorbell handshake int failed (line=%d)\n",
5310 ioc->name, __LINE__);
5311 return -EFAULT;
5312 }
5313 if (i >= reply_bytes/2) /* overflow case */
5314 readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell);
5315 else
5316 reply[i] = le16_to_cpu(readl(&ioc->chip->Doorbell)
5317 & MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
5318 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5319 }
5320
5321 _base_wait_for_doorbell_int(ioc, 5);
5322 if (_base_wait_for_doorbell_not_used(ioc, 5) != 0) {
5323 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5324 "doorbell is in use (line=%d)\n", ioc->name, __LINE__));
5325 }
5326 writel(0, &ioc->chip->HostInterruptStatus);
5327
5328 if (ioc->logging_level & MPT_DEBUG_INIT) {
5329 mfp = (__le32 *)reply;
5330 pr_info("\toffset:data\n");
5331 for (i = 0; i < reply_bytes/4; i++)
5332 pr_info("\t[0x%02x]:%08x\n", i*4,
5333 le32_to_cpu(mfp[i]));
5334 }
5335 return 0;
5336}
5337
5338/**
5339 * mpt3sas_base_sas_iounit_control - send sas iounit control to FW
5340 * @ioc: per adapter object
5341 * @mpi_reply: the reply payload from FW
5342 * @mpi_request: the request payload sent to FW
5343 *
5344 * The SAS IO Unit Control Request message allows the host to perform low-level
5345 * operations, such as resets on the PHYs of the IO Unit, also allows the host
5346 * to obtain the IOC assigned device handles for a device if it has other
5347 * identifying information about the device, in addition allows the host to
5348 * remove IOC resources associated with the device.
5349 *
5350 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5351 */
5352int
5353mpt3sas_base_sas_iounit_control(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
5354 Mpi2SasIoUnitControlReply_t *mpi_reply,
5355 Mpi2SasIoUnitControlRequest_t *mpi_request)
5356{
5357 u16 smid;
5358 u32 ioc_state;
5359 bool issue_reset = false;
5360 int rc;
5361 void *request;
5362 u16 wait_state_count;
5363
5364 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
5365 __func__));
5366
5367 mutex_lock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
5368
5369 if (ioc->base_cmds.status != MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED) {
5370 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: base_cmd in use\n",
5371 ioc->name, __func__);
5372 rc = -EAGAIN;
5373 goto out;
5374 }
5375
5376 wait_state_count = 0;
5377 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
5378 while (ioc_state != MPI2_IOC_STATE_OPERATIONAL) {
5379 if (wait_state_count++ == 10) {
5380 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5381 "%s: failed due to ioc not operational\n",
5382 ioc->name, __func__);
5383 rc = -EFAULT;
5384 goto out;
5385 }
5386 ssleep(1);
5387 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
5388 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5389 "%s: waiting for operational state(count=%d)\n",
5390 ioc->name, __func__, wait_state_count);
5391 }
5392
5393 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->base_cb_idx);
5394 if (!smid) {
5395 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
5396 ioc->name, __func__);
5397 rc = -EAGAIN;
5398 goto out;
5399 }
5400
5401 rc = 0;
5402 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
5403 request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
5404 ioc->base_cmds.smid = smid;
5405 memcpy(request, mpi_request, sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlRequest_t));
5406 if (mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_HARD_RESET ||
5407 mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_LINK_RESET)
5408 ioc->ioc_link_reset_in_progress = 1;
5409 init_completion(&ioc->base_cmds.done);
5410 mpt3sas_base_put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
5411 wait_for_completion_timeout(&ioc->base_cmds.done,
5412 msecs_to_jiffies(10000));
5413 if ((mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_HARD_RESET ||
5414 mpi_request->Operation == MPI2_SAS_OP_PHY_LINK_RESET) &&
5415 ioc->ioc_link_reset_in_progress)
5416 ioc->ioc_link_reset_in_progress = 0;
5417 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE)) {
5418 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: timeout\n",
5419 ioc->name, __func__);
5420 _debug_dump_mf(mpi_request,
5421 sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlRequest_t)/4);
5422 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_RESET))
5423 issue_reset = true;
5424 goto issue_host_reset;
5425 }
5426 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_REPLY_VALID)
5427 memcpy(mpi_reply, ioc->base_cmds.reply,
5428 sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlReply_t));
5429 else
5430 memset(mpi_reply, 0, sizeof(Mpi2SasIoUnitControlReply_t));
5431 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
5432 goto out;
5433
5434 issue_host_reset:
5435 if (issue_reset)
5436 mpt3sas_base_hard_reset_handler(ioc, FORCE_BIG_HAMMER);
5437 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
5438 rc = -EFAULT;
5439 out:
5440 mutex_unlock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
5441 return rc;
5442}
5443
5444/**
5445 * mpt3sas_base_scsi_enclosure_processor - sending request to sep device
5446 * @ioc: per adapter object
5447 * @mpi_reply: the reply payload from FW
5448 * @mpi_request: the request payload sent to FW
5449 *
5450 * The SCSI Enclosure Processor request message causes the IOC to
5451 * communicate with SES devices to control LED status signals.
5452 *
5453 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5454 */
5455int
5456mpt3sas_base_scsi_enclosure_processor(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
5457 Mpi2SepReply_t *mpi_reply, Mpi2SepRequest_t *mpi_request)
5458{
5459 u16 smid;
5460 u32 ioc_state;
5461 bool issue_reset = false;
5462 int rc;
5463 void *request;
5464 u16 wait_state_count;
5465
5466 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
5467 __func__));
5468
5469 mutex_lock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
5470
5471 if (ioc->base_cmds.status != MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED) {
5472 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: base_cmd in use\n",
5473 ioc->name, __func__);
5474 rc = -EAGAIN;
5475 goto out;
5476 }
5477
5478 wait_state_count = 0;
5479 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
5480 while (ioc_state != MPI2_IOC_STATE_OPERATIONAL) {
5481 if (wait_state_count++ == 10) {
5482 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
5483 "%s: failed due to ioc not operational\n",
5484 ioc->name, __func__);
5485 rc = -EFAULT;
5486 goto out;
5487 }
5488 ssleep(1);
5489 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 1);
5490 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5491 "%s: waiting for operational state(count=%d)\n",
5492 ioc->name,
5493 __func__, wait_state_count);
5494 }
5495
5496 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->base_cb_idx);
5497 if (!smid) {
5498 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
5499 ioc->name, __func__);
5500 rc = -EAGAIN;
5501 goto out;
5502 }
5503
5504 rc = 0;
5505 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
5506 request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
5507 ioc->base_cmds.smid = smid;
5508 memcpy(request, mpi_request, sizeof(Mpi2SepReply_t));
5509 init_completion(&ioc->base_cmds.done);
5510 mpt3sas_base_put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
5511 wait_for_completion_timeout(&ioc->base_cmds.done,
5512 msecs_to_jiffies(10000));
5513 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE)) {
5514 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: timeout\n",
5515 ioc->name, __func__);
5516 _debug_dump_mf(mpi_request,
5517 sizeof(Mpi2SepRequest_t)/4);
5518 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_RESET))
5519 issue_reset = false;
5520 goto issue_host_reset;
5521 }
5522 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_REPLY_VALID)
5523 memcpy(mpi_reply, ioc->base_cmds.reply,
5524 sizeof(Mpi2SepReply_t));
5525 else
5526 memset(mpi_reply, 0, sizeof(Mpi2SepReply_t));
5527 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
5528 goto out;
5529
5530 issue_host_reset:
5531 if (issue_reset)
5532 mpt3sas_base_hard_reset_handler(ioc, FORCE_BIG_HAMMER);
5533 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
5534 rc = -EFAULT;
5535 out:
5536 mutex_unlock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
5537 return rc;
5538}
