5540/**
5541 * _base_get_port_facts - obtain port facts reply and save in ioc
5542 * @ioc: per adapter object
5543 *
5544 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5545 */
5546static int
5547_base_get_port_facts(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int port)
5548{
5549 Mpi2PortFactsRequest_t mpi_request;
5550 Mpi2PortFactsReply_t mpi_reply;
5551 struct mpt3sas_port_facts *pfacts;
5552 int mpi_reply_sz, mpi_request_sz, r;
5553
5554 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
5555 __func__));
5556
5557 mpi_reply_sz = sizeof(Mpi2PortFactsReply_t);
5558 mpi_request_sz = sizeof(Mpi2PortFactsRequest_t);
5559 memset(&mpi_request, 0, mpi_request_sz);
5560 mpi_request.Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_PORT_FACTS;
5561 mpi_request.PortNumber = port;
5562 r = _base_handshake_req_reply_wait(ioc, mpi_request_sz,
5563 (u32 *)&mpi_request, mpi_reply_sz, (u16 *)&mpi_reply, 5);
5564
5565 if (r != 0) {
5566 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: handshake failed (r=%d)\n",
5567 ioc->name, __func__, r);
5568 return r;
5569 }
5570
5571 pfacts = &ioc->pfacts[port];
5572 memset(pfacts, 0, sizeof(struct mpt3sas_port_facts));
5573 pfacts->PortNumber = mpi_reply.PortNumber;
5574 pfacts->VP_ID = mpi_reply.VP_ID;
5575 pfacts->VF_ID = mpi_reply.VF_ID;
5576 pfacts->MaxPostedCmdBuffers =
5577 le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MaxPostedCmdBuffers);
5578
5579 return 0;
5580}
5581
5582/**
5583 * _base_wait_for_iocstate - Wait until the card is in READY or OPERATIONAL
5584 * @ioc: per adapter object
5585 * @timeout:
5586 *
5587 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5588 */
5589static int
5590_base_wait_for_iocstate(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int timeout)
5591{
5592 u32 ioc_state;
5593 int rc;
5594
5595 dinitprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
5596 __func__));
5597
5598 if (ioc->pci_error_recovery) {
5599 dfailprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT
5600 "%s: host in pci error recovery\n", ioc->name, __func__));
5601 return -EFAULT;
5602 }
5603
5604 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 0);
5605 dhsprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: ioc_state(0x%08x)\n",
5606 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_state));
5607
5608 if (((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_READY) ||
5609 (ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_OPERATIONAL)
5610 return 0;
5611
5612 if (ioc_state & MPI2_DOORBELL_USED) {
5613 dhsprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT
5614 "unexpected doorbell active!\n", ioc->name));
5615 goto issue_diag_reset;
5616 }
5617
5618 if ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_FAULT) {
5619 mpt3sas_base_fault_info(ioc, ioc_state &
5620 MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
5621 goto issue_diag_reset;
5622 }
5623
5624 ioc_state = _base_wait_on_iocstate(ioc, MPI2_IOC_STATE_READY, timeout);
5625 if (ioc_state) {
5626 dfailprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT
5627 "%s: failed going to ready state (ioc_state=0x%x)\n",
5628 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_state));
5629 return -EFAULT;
5630 }
5631
5632 issue_diag_reset:
5633 rc = _base_diag_reset(ioc);
5634 return rc;
5635}
5636
5637/**
5638 * _base_get_ioc_facts - obtain ioc facts reply and save in ioc
5639 * @ioc: per adapter object
5640 *
5641 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5642 */
5643static int
5644_base_get_ioc_facts(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
5645{
5646 Mpi2IOCFactsRequest_t mpi_request;
5647 Mpi2IOCFactsReply_t mpi_reply;
5648 struct mpt3sas_facts *facts;
5649 int mpi_reply_sz, mpi_request_sz, r;
5650
5651 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
5652 __func__));
5653
5654 r = _base_wait_for_iocstate(ioc, 10);
5655 if (r) {
5656 dfailprintk(ioc, printk(MPT3SAS_FMT
5657 "%s: failed getting to correct state\n",
5658 ioc->name, __func__));
5659 return r;
5660 }
5661 mpi_reply_sz = sizeof(Mpi2IOCFactsReply_t);
5662 mpi_request_sz = sizeof(Mpi2IOCFactsRequest_t);
5663 memset(&mpi_request, 0, mpi_request_sz);
5664 mpi_request.Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_IOC_FACTS;
5665 r = _base_handshake_req_reply_wait(ioc, mpi_request_sz,
5666 (u32 *)&mpi_request, mpi_reply_sz, (u16 *)&mpi_reply, 5);
5667
5668 if (r != 0) {
5669 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: handshake failed (r=%d)\n",
5670 ioc->name, __func__, r);
5671 return r;
5672 }
5673
5674 facts = &ioc->facts;
5675 memset(facts, 0, sizeof(struct mpt3sas_facts));
5676 facts->MsgVersion = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MsgVersion);
5677 facts->HeaderVersion = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.HeaderVersion);
5678 facts->VP_ID = mpi_reply.VP_ID;
5679 facts->VF_ID = mpi_reply.VF_ID;
5680 facts->IOCExceptions = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCExceptions);
5681 facts->MaxChainDepth = mpi_reply.MaxChainDepth;
5682 facts->WhoInit = mpi_reply.WhoInit;
5683 facts->NumberOfPorts = mpi_reply.NumberOfPorts;
5684 facts->MaxMSIxVectors = mpi_reply.MaxMSIxVectors;
5685 facts->RequestCredit = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.RequestCredit);
5686 facts->MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth =
5687 le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MaxReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth);
5688 facts->ProductID = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.ProductID);
5689 facts->IOCCapabilities = le32_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCCapabilities);
5690 if ((facts->IOCCapabilities & MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_INTEGRATED_RAID))
5691 ioc->ir_firmware = 1;
5692 if ((facts->IOCCapabilities &
5693 MPI2_IOCFACTS_CAPABILITY_RDPQ_ARRAY_CAPABLE) && (!reset_devices))
5694 ioc->rdpq_array_capable = 1;
5695 facts->FWVersion.Word = le32_to_cpu(mpi_reply.FWVersion.Word);
5696 facts->IOCRequestFrameSize =
5697 le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCRequestFrameSize);
5698 if (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged != MPI2_VERSION) {
5699 facts->IOCMaxChainSegmentSize =
5700 le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCMaxChainSegmentSize);
5701 }
5702 facts->MaxInitiators = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MaxInitiators);
5703 facts->MaxTargets = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MaxTargets);
5704 ioc->shost->max_id = -1;
5705 facts->MaxSasExpanders = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MaxSasExpanders);
5706 facts->MaxEnclosures = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MaxEnclosures);
5707 facts->ProtocolFlags = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.ProtocolFlags);
5708 facts->HighPriorityCredit =
5709 le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.HighPriorityCredit);
5710 facts->ReplyFrameSize = mpi_reply.ReplyFrameSize;
5711 facts->MaxDevHandle = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.MaxDevHandle);
5712 facts->CurrentHostPageSize = mpi_reply.CurrentHostPageSize;
5713
5714 /*
5715 * Get the Page Size from IOC Facts. If it's 0, default to 4k.
5716 */
5717 ioc->page_size = 1 << facts->CurrentHostPageSize;
5718 if (ioc->page_size == 1) {
5719 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "CurrentHostPageSize is 0: Setting "
5720 "default host page size to 4k\n", ioc->name);
5721 ioc->page_size = 1 << MPT3SAS_HOST_PAGE_SIZE_4K;
5722 }
5723 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "CurrentHostPageSize(%d)\n",
5724 ioc->name, facts->CurrentHostPageSize));
5725
5726 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5727 "hba queue depth(%d), max chains per io(%d)\n",
5728 ioc->name, facts->RequestCredit,
5729 facts->MaxChainDepth));
5730 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
5731 "request frame size(%d), reply frame size(%d)\n", ioc->name,
5732 facts->IOCRequestFrameSize * 4, facts->ReplyFrameSize * 4));
5733 return 0;
5734}
5735
5736/**
5737 * _base_send_ioc_init - send ioc_init to firmware
5738 * @ioc: per adapter object
5739 *
5740 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5741 */
5742static int
5743_base_send_ioc_init(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
5744{
5745 Mpi2IOCInitRequest_t mpi_request;
5746 Mpi2IOCInitReply_t mpi_reply;
5747 int i, r = 0;
5748 ktime_t current_time;
5749 u16 ioc_status;
5750 u32 reply_post_free_array_sz = 0;
5751
5752 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
5753 __func__));
5754
5755 memset(&mpi_request, 0, sizeof(Mpi2IOCInitRequest_t));
5756 mpi_request.Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_IOC_INIT;
5757 mpi_request.WhoInit = MPI2_WHOINIT_HOST_DRIVER;
5758 mpi_request.VF_ID = 0; /* TODO */
5759 mpi_request.VP_ID = 0;
5760 mpi_request.MsgVersion = cpu_to_le16(ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged);
5761 mpi_request.HeaderVersion = cpu_to_le16(MPI2_HEADER_VERSION);
5762 mpi_request.HostPageSize = MPT3SAS_HOST_PAGE_SIZE_4K;
5763
5764 if (_base_is_controller_msix_enabled(ioc))
5765 mpi_request.HostMSIxVectors = ioc->reply_queue_count;
5766 mpi_request.SystemRequestFrameSize = cpu_to_le16(ioc->request_sz/4);
5767 mpi_request.ReplyDescriptorPostQueueDepth =
5768 cpu_to_le16(ioc->reply_post_queue_depth);
5769 mpi_request.ReplyFreeQueueDepth =
5770 cpu_to_le16(ioc->reply_free_queue_depth);
5771
5772 mpi_request.SenseBufferAddressHigh =
5773 cpu_to_le32((u64)ioc->sense_dma >> 32);
5774 mpi_request.SystemReplyAddressHigh =
5775 cpu_to_le32((u64)ioc->reply_dma >> 32);
5776 mpi_request.SystemRequestFrameBaseAddress =
5777 cpu_to_le64((u64)ioc->request_dma);
5778 mpi_request.ReplyFreeQueueAddress =
5779 cpu_to_le64((u64)ioc->reply_free_dma);
5780
5781 if (ioc->rdpq_array_enable) {
5782 reply_post_free_array_sz = ioc->reply_queue_count *
5783 sizeof(Mpi2IOCInitRDPQArrayEntry);
5784 memset(ioc->reply_post_free_array, 0, reply_post_free_array_sz);
5785 for (i = 0; i < ioc->reply_queue_count; i++)
5786 ioc->reply_post_free_array[i].RDPQBaseAddress =
5787 cpu_to_le64(
5788 (u64)ioc->reply_post[i].reply_post_free_dma);
5789 mpi_request.MsgFlags = MPI2_IOCINIT_MSGFLAG_RDPQ_ARRAY_MODE;
5790 mpi_request.ReplyDescriptorPostQueueAddress =
5791 cpu_to_le64((u64)ioc->reply_post_free_array_dma);
5792 } else {
5793 mpi_request.ReplyDescriptorPostQueueAddress =
5794 cpu_to_le64((u64)ioc->reply_post[0].reply_post_free_dma);
5795 }
5796
5797 /* This time stamp specifies number of milliseconds
5798 * since epoch ~ midnight January 1, 1970.
5799 */
5800 current_time = ktime_get_real();
5801 mpi_request.TimeStamp = cpu_to_le64(ktime_to_ms(current_time));
5802
5803 if (ioc->logging_level & MPT_DEBUG_INIT) {
5804 __le32 *mfp;
5805 int i;
5806
5807 mfp = (__le32 *)&mpi_request;
5808 pr_info("\toffset:data\n");
5809 for (i = 0; i < sizeof(Mpi2IOCInitRequest_t)/4; i++)
5810 pr_info("\t[0x%02x]:%08x\n", i*4,
5811 le32_to_cpu(mfp[i]));
5812 }
5813
5814 r = _base_handshake_req_reply_wait(ioc,
5815 sizeof(Mpi2IOCInitRequest_t), (u32 *)&mpi_request,
5816 sizeof(Mpi2IOCInitReply_t), (u16 *)&mpi_reply, 10);
5817
5818 if (r != 0) {
5819 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: handshake failed (r=%d)\n",
5820 ioc->name, __func__, r);
5821 return r;
5822 }
5823
5824 ioc_status = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply.IOCStatus) & MPI2_IOCSTATUS_MASK;
5825 if (ioc_status != MPI2_IOCSTATUS_SUCCESS ||
5826 mpi_reply.IOCLogInfo) {
5827 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed\n", ioc->name, __func__);
5828 r = -EIO;
5829 }
5830
5831 return r;
5832}
5833
5834/**
5835 * mpt3sas_port_enable_done - command completion routine for port enable
5836 * @ioc: per adapter object
5837 * @smid: system request message index
5838 * @msix_index: MSIX table index supplied by the OS
5839 * @reply: reply message frame(lower 32bit addr)
5840 *
5841 * Return 1 meaning mf should be freed from _base_interrupt
5842 * 0 means the mf is freed from this function.
5843 */
5844u8
5845mpt3sas_port_enable_done(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u16 smid, u8 msix_index,
5846 u32 reply)
5847{
5848 MPI2DefaultReply_t *mpi_reply;
5849 u16 ioc_status;
5850
5851 if (ioc->port_enable_cmds.status == MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED)
5852 return 1;
5853
5854 mpi_reply = mpt3sas_base_get_reply_virt_addr(ioc, reply);
5855 if (!mpi_reply)
5856 return 1;
5857
5858 if (mpi_reply->Function != MPI2_FUNCTION_PORT_ENABLE)
5859 return 1;
5860
5861 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status &= ~MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
5862 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status |= MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE;
5863 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status |= MPT3_CMD_REPLY_VALID;
5864 memcpy(ioc->port_enable_cmds.reply, mpi_reply, mpi_reply->MsgLength*4);
5865 ioc_status = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply->IOCStatus) & MPI2_IOCSTATUS_MASK;
5866 if (ioc_status != MPI2_IOCSTATUS_SUCCESS)
5867 ioc->port_enable_failed = 1;
5868
5869 if (ioc->is_driver_loading) {
5870 if (ioc_status == MPI2_IOCSTATUS_SUCCESS) {
5871 mpt3sas_port_enable_complete(ioc);
5872 return 1;
5873 } else {
5874 ioc->start_scan_failed = ioc_status;
5875 ioc->start_scan = 0;
5876 return 1;
5877 }
5878 }
5879 complete(&ioc->port_enable_cmds.done);
5880 return 1;
5881}
5882
5883/**
5884 * _base_send_port_enable - send port_enable(discovery stuff) to firmware
5885 * @ioc: per adapter object
5886 *
5887 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5888 */
5889static int
5890_base_send_port_enable(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
5891{
5892 Mpi2PortEnableRequest_t *mpi_request;
5893 Mpi2PortEnableReply_t *mpi_reply;
5894 int r = 0;
5895 u16 smid;
5896 u16 ioc_status;
5897
5898 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "sending port enable !!\n", ioc->name);
5899
5900 if (ioc->port_enable_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
5901 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: internal command already in use\n",
5902 ioc->name, __func__);
5903 return -EAGAIN;
5904 }
5905
5906 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->port_enable_cb_idx);
5907 if (!smid) {
5908 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
5909 ioc->name, __func__);
5910 return -EAGAIN;
5911 }
5912
5913 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
5914 mpi_request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
5915 ioc->port_enable_cmds.smid = smid;
5916 memset(mpi_request, 0, sizeof(Mpi2PortEnableRequest_t));
5917 mpi_request->Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_PORT_ENABLE;
5918
5919 init_completion(&ioc->port_enable_cmds.done);
5920 mpt3sas_base_put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
5921 wait_for_completion_timeout(&ioc->port_enable_cmds.done, 300*HZ);
5922 if (!(ioc->port_enable_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE)) {
5923 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: timeout\n",
5924 ioc->name, __func__);
5925 _debug_dump_mf(mpi_request,
5926 sizeof(Mpi2PortEnableRequest_t)/4);
5927 if (ioc->port_enable_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_RESET)
5928 r = -EFAULT;
5929 else
5930 r = -ETIME;
5931 goto out;
5932 }
5933
5934 mpi_reply = ioc->port_enable_cmds.reply;
5935 ioc_status = le16_to_cpu(mpi_reply->IOCStatus) & MPI2_IOCSTATUS_MASK;
5936 if (ioc_status != MPI2_IOCSTATUS_SUCCESS) {
5937 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed with (ioc_status=0x%08x)\n",
5938 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_status);
5939 r = -EFAULT;
5940 goto out;
5941 }
5942
5943 out:
5944 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
5945 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "port enable: %s\n", ioc->name, ((r == 0) ?
5946 "SUCCESS" : "FAILED"));
5947 return r;
5948}
5949
5950/**
5951 * mpt3sas_port_enable - initiate firmware discovery (don't wait for reply)
5952 * @ioc: per adapter object
5953 *
5954 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
5955 */
5956int
5957mpt3sas_port_enable(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
5958{
5959 Mpi2PortEnableRequest_t *mpi_request;
5960 u16 smid;
5961
5962 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "sending port enable !!\n", ioc->name);
5963
5964 if (ioc->port_enable_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
5965 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: internal command already in use\n",
5966 ioc->name, __func__);
5967 return -EAGAIN;
5968 }
5969
5970 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->port_enable_cb_idx);
5971 if (!smid) {
5972 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
5973 ioc->name, __func__);
5974 return -EAGAIN;
5975 }
5976
5977 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
5978 mpi_request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
5979 ioc->port_enable_cmds.smid = smid;
5980 memset(mpi_request, 0, sizeof(Mpi2PortEnableRequest_t));
5981 mpi_request->Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_PORT_ENABLE;
5982
5983 mpt3sas_base_put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
5984 return 0;
5985}
5986
5987/**
5988 * _base_determine_wait_on_discovery - desposition
5989 * @ioc: per adapter object
5990 *
5991 * Decide whether to wait on discovery to complete. Used to either
5992 * locate boot device, or report volumes ahead of physical devices.
5993 *
5994 * Returns 1 for wait, 0 for don't wait
5995 */
5996static int
5997_base_determine_wait_on_discovery(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
5998{
5999 /* We wait for discovery to complete if IR firmware is loaded.
6000 * The sas topology events arrive before PD events, so we need time to
6001 * turn on the bit in ioc->pd_handles to indicate PD
6002 * Also, it maybe required to report Volumes ahead of physical
6003 * devices when MPI2_IOCPAGE8_IRFLAGS_LOW_VOLUME_MAPPING is set.
6004 */
6005 if (ioc->ir_firmware)
6006 return 1;
6007
6008 /* if no Bios, then we don't need to wait */
6009 if (!ioc->bios_pg3.BiosVersion)
6010 return 0;
6011
6012 /* Bios is present, then we drop down here.
6013 *
6014 * If there any entries in the Bios Page 2, then we wait
6015 * for discovery to complete.
6016 */
6017
6018 /* Current Boot Device */
6019 if ((ioc->bios_pg2.CurrentBootDeviceForm &
6020 MPI2_BIOSPAGE2_FORM_MASK) ==
6021 MPI2_BIOSPAGE2_FORM_NO_DEVICE_SPECIFIED &&
6022 /* Request Boot Device */
6023 (ioc->bios_pg2.ReqBootDeviceForm &
6024 MPI2_BIOSPAGE2_FORM_MASK) ==
6025 MPI2_BIOSPAGE2_FORM_NO_DEVICE_SPECIFIED &&
6026 /* Alternate Request Boot Device */
6027 (ioc->bios_pg2.ReqAltBootDeviceForm &
6028 MPI2_BIOSPAGE2_FORM_MASK) ==
6029 MPI2_BIOSPAGE2_FORM_NO_DEVICE_SPECIFIED)
6030 return 0;
6031
6032 return 1;
6033}
6034
6035/**
6036 * _base_unmask_events - turn on notification for this event
6037 * @ioc: per adapter object
6038 * @event: firmware event
6039 *
6040 * The mask is stored in ioc->event_masks.
6041 */
6042static void
6043_base_unmask_events(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u16 event)
6044{
6045 u32 desired_event;
6046
6047 if (event >= 128)
6048 return;
6049
6050 desired_event = (1 << (event % 32));
6051
6052 if (event < 32)
6053 ioc->event_masks[0] &= ~desired_event;
6054 else if (event < 64)
6055 ioc->event_masks[1] &= ~desired_event;
6056 else if (event < 96)
6057 ioc->event_masks[2] &= ~desired_event;
6058 else if (event < 128)
6059 ioc->event_masks[3] &= ~desired_event;
6060}
6061
6062/**
6063 * _base_event_notification - send event notification
6064 * @ioc: per adapter object
6065 *
6066 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
6067 */
6068static int
6069_base_event_notification(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
6070{
6071 Mpi2EventNotificationRequest_t *mpi_request;
6072 u16 smid;
6073 int r = 0;
6074 int i;
6075
6076 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
6077 __func__));
6078
6079 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
6080 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: internal command already in use\n",
6081 ioc->name, __func__);
6082 return -EAGAIN;
6083 }
6084
6085 smid = mpt3sas_base_get_smid(ioc, ioc->base_cb_idx);
6086 if (!smid) {
6087 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: failed obtaining a smid\n",
6088 ioc->name, __func__);
6089 return -EAGAIN;
6090 }
6091 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_PENDING;
6092 mpi_request = mpt3sas_base_get_msg_frame(ioc, smid);
6093 ioc->base_cmds.smid = smid;
6094 memset(mpi_request, 0, sizeof(Mpi2EventNotificationRequest_t));
6095 mpi_request->Function = MPI2_FUNCTION_EVENT_NOTIFICATION;
6096 mpi_request->VF_ID = 0; /* TODO */
6097 mpi_request->VP_ID = 0;
6098 for (i = 0; i < MPI2_EVENT_NOTIFY_EVENTMASK_WORDS; i++)
6099 mpi_request->EventMasks[i] =
6100 cpu_to_le32(ioc->event_masks[i]);
6101 init_completion(&ioc->base_cmds.done);
6102 mpt3sas_base_put_smid_default(ioc, smid);
6103 wait_for_completion_timeout(&ioc->base_cmds.done, 30*HZ);
6104 if (!(ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_COMPLETE)) {
6105 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: timeout\n",
6106 ioc->name, __func__);
6107 _debug_dump_mf(mpi_request,
6108 sizeof(Mpi2EventNotificationRequest_t)/4);
6109 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_RESET)
6110 r = -EFAULT;
6111 else
6112 r = -ETIME;
6113 } else
6114 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: complete\n",
6115 ioc->name, __func__));
6116 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6117 return r;
6118}
6119
6120/**
6121 * mpt3sas_base_validate_event_type - validating event types
6122 * @ioc: per adapter object
6123 * @event: firmware event
6124 *
6125 * This will turn on firmware event notification when application
6126 * ask for that event. We don't mask events that are already enabled.
6127 */
6128void
6129mpt3sas_base_validate_event_type(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, u32 *event_type)
6130{
6131 int i, j;
6132 u32 event_mask, desired_event;
6133 u8 send_update_to_fw;
6134
6135 for (i = 0, send_update_to_fw = 0; i <
6136 MPI2_EVENT_NOTIFY_EVENTMASK_WORDS; i++) {
6137 event_mask = ~event_type[i];
6138 desired_event = 1;
6139 for (j = 0; j < 32; j++) {
6140 if (!(event_mask & desired_event) &&
6141 (ioc->event_masks[i] & desired_event)) {
6142 ioc->event_masks[i] &= ~desired_event;
6143 send_update_to_fw = 1;
6144 }
6145 desired_event = (desired_event << 1);
6146 }
6147 }
6148
6149 if (!send_update_to_fw)
6150 return;
6151
6152 mutex_lock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
6153 _base_event_notification(ioc);
6154 mutex_unlock(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
6155}
6156
6157/**
6158 * _base_diag_reset - the "big hammer" start of day reset
6159 * @ioc: per adapter object
6160 *
6161 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
6162 */
6163static int
6164_base_diag_reset(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
6165{
6166 u32 host_diagnostic;
6167 u32 ioc_state;
6168 u32 count;
6169 u32 hcb_size;
6170
6171 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "sending diag reset !!\n", ioc->name);
6172
6173 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "clear interrupts\n",
6174 ioc->name));
6175
6176 count = 0;
6177 do {
6178 /* Write magic sequence to WriteSequence register
6179 * Loop until in diagnostic mode
6180 */
6181 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6182 "write magic sequence\n", ioc->name));
6183 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_FLUSH_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6184 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_1ST_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6185 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_2ND_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6186 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_3RD_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6187 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_4TH_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6188 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_5TH_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6189 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_6TH_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6190
6191 /* wait 100 msec */
6192 msleep(100);
6193
6194 if (count++ > 20)
6195 goto out;
6196
6197 host_diagnostic = readl(&ioc->chip->HostDiagnostic);
6198 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6199 "wrote magic sequence: count(%d), host_diagnostic(0x%08x)\n",
6200 ioc->name, count, host_diagnostic));
6201
6202 } while ((host_diagnostic & MPI2_DIAG_DIAG_WRITE_ENABLE) == 0);
6203
6204 hcb_size = readl(&ioc->chip->HCBSize);
6205
6206 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "diag reset: issued\n",
6207 ioc->name));
6208 writel(host_diagnostic | MPI2_DIAG_RESET_ADAPTER,
6209 &ioc->chip->HostDiagnostic);
6210
6211 /*This delay allows the chip PCIe hardware time to finish reset tasks*/
6212 msleep(MPI2_HARD_RESET_PCIE_FIRST_READ_DELAY_MICRO_SEC/1000);
6213
6214 /* Approximately 300 second max wait */
6215 for (count = 0; count < (300000000 /
6216 MPI2_HARD_RESET_PCIE_SECOND_READ_DELAY_MICRO_SEC); count++) {
6217
6218 host_diagnostic = readl(&ioc->chip->HostDiagnostic);
6219
6220 if (host_diagnostic == 0xFFFFFFFF)
6221 goto out;
6222 if (!(host_diagnostic & MPI2_DIAG_RESET_ADAPTER))
6223 break;
6224
6225 msleep(MPI2_HARD_RESET_PCIE_SECOND_READ_DELAY_MICRO_SEC / 1000);
6226 }
6227
6228 if (host_diagnostic & MPI2_DIAG_HCB_MODE) {
6229
6230 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6231 "restart the adapter assuming the HCB Address points to good F/W\n",
6232 ioc->name));
6233 host_diagnostic &= ~MPI2_DIAG_BOOT_DEVICE_SELECT_MASK;
6234 host_diagnostic |= MPI2_DIAG_BOOT_DEVICE_SELECT_HCDW;
6235 writel(host_diagnostic, &ioc->chip->HostDiagnostic);
6236
6237 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6238 "re-enable the HCDW\n", ioc->name));
6239 writel(hcb_size | MPI2_HCB_SIZE_HCB_ENABLE,
6240 &ioc->chip->HCBSize);
6241 }
6242
6243 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "restart the adapter\n",
6244 ioc->name));
6245 writel(host_diagnostic & ~MPI2_DIAG_HOLD_IOC_RESET,
6246 &ioc->chip->HostDiagnostic);
6247
6248 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6249 "disable writes to the diagnostic register\n", ioc->name));
6250 writel(MPI2_WRSEQ_FLUSH_KEY_VALUE, &ioc->chip->WriteSequence);
6251
6252 drsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6253 "Wait for FW to go to the READY state\n", ioc->name));
6254 ioc_state = _base_wait_on_iocstate(ioc, MPI2_IOC_STATE_READY, 20);
6255 if (ioc_state) {
6256 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
6257 "%s: failed going to ready state (ioc_state=0x%x)\n",
6258 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_state);
6259 goto out;
6260 }
6261
6262 pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "diag reset: SUCCESS\n", ioc->name);
6263 return 0;
6264
6265 out:
6266 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "diag reset: FAILED\n", ioc->name);
6267 return -EFAULT;
6268}
6269
6270/**
6271 * _base_make_ioc_ready - put controller in READY state
6272 * @ioc: per adapter object
6273 * @type: FORCE_BIG_HAMMER or SOFT_RESET
6274 *
6275 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
6276 */
6277static int
6278_base_make_ioc_ready(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, enum reset_type type)
6279{
6280 u32 ioc_state;
6281 int rc;
6282 int count;
6283
6284 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
6285 __func__));
6286
6287 if (ioc->pci_error_recovery)
6288 return 0;
6289
6290 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 0);
6291 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: ioc_state(0x%08x)\n",
6292 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_state));
6293
6294 /* if in RESET state, it should move to READY state shortly */
6295 count = 0;
6296 if ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_RESET) {
6297 while ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) !=
6298 MPI2_IOC_STATE_READY) {
6299 if (count++ == 10) {
6300 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT
6301 "%s: failed going to ready state (ioc_state=0x%x)\n",
6302 ioc->name, __func__, ioc_state);
6303 return -EFAULT;
6304 }
6305 ssleep(1);
6306 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 0);
6307 }
6308 }
6309
6310 if ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_READY)
6311 return 0;
6312
6313 if (ioc_state & MPI2_DOORBELL_USED) {
6314 dhsprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6315 "unexpected doorbell active!\n",
6316 ioc->name));
6317 goto issue_diag_reset;
6318 }
6319
6320 if ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_FAULT) {
6321 mpt3sas_base_fault_info(ioc, ioc_state &
6322 MPI2_DOORBELL_DATA_MASK);
6323 goto issue_diag_reset;
6324 }
6325
6326 if (type == FORCE_BIG_HAMMER)
6327 goto issue_diag_reset;
6328
6329 if ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_OPERATIONAL)
6330 if (!(_base_send_ioc_reset(ioc,
6331 MPI2_FUNCTION_IOC_MESSAGE_UNIT_RESET, 15))) {
6332 return 0;
6333 }
6334
6335 issue_diag_reset:
6336 rc = _base_diag_reset(ioc);
6337 return rc;
6338}
6339
6340/**
6341 * _base_make_ioc_operational - put controller in OPERATIONAL state
6342 * @ioc: per adapter object
6343 *
6344 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
6345 */
6346static int
6347_base_make_ioc_operational(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
6348{
6349 int r, i, index;
6350 unsigned long flags;
6351 u32 reply_address;
6352 u16 smid;
6353 struct _tr_list *delayed_tr, *delayed_tr_next;
6354 struct _sc_list *delayed_sc, *delayed_sc_next;
6355 struct _event_ack_list *delayed_event_ack, *delayed_event_ack_next;
6356 u8 hide_flag;
6357 struct adapter_reply_queue *reply_q;
6358 Mpi2ReplyDescriptorsUnion_t *reply_post_free_contig;
6359
6360 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
6361 __func__));
6362
6363 /* clean the delayed target reset list */
6364 list_for_each_entry_safe(delayed_tr, delayed_tr_next,
6365 &ioc->delayed_tr_list, list) {
6366 list_del(&delayed_tr->list);
6367 kfree(delayed_tr);
6368 }
6369
6370
6371 list_for_each_entry_safe(delayed_tr, delayed_tr_next,
6372 &ioc->delayed_tr_volume_list, list) {
6373 list_del(&delayed_tr->list);
6374 kfree(delayed_tr);
6375 }
6376
6377 list_for_each_entry_safe(delayed_sc, delayed_sc_next,
6378 &ioc->delayed_sc_list, list) {
6379 list_del(&delayed_sc->list);
6380 kfree(delayed_sc);
6381 }
6382
6383 list_for_each_entry_safe(delayed_event_ack, delayed_event_ack_next,
6384 &ioc->delayed_event_ack_list, list) {
6385 list_del(&delayed_event_ack->list);
6386 kfree(delayed_event_ack);
6387 }
6388
6389 spin_lock_irqsave(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
6390
6391 /* hi-priority queue */
6392 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ioc->hpr_free_list);
6393 smid = ioc->hi_priority_smid;
6394 for (i = 0; i < ioc->hi_priority_depth; i++, smid++) {
6395 ioc->hpr_lookup[i].cb_idx = 0xFF;
6396 ioc->hpr_lookup[i].smid = smid;
6397 list_add_tail(&ioc->hpr_lookup[i].tracker_list,
6398 &ioc->hpr_free_list);
6399 }
6400
6401 /* internal queue */
6402 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&ioc->internal_free_list);
6403 smid = ioc->internal_smid;
6404 for (i = 0; i < ioc->internal_depth; i++, smid++) {
6405 ioc->internal_lookup[i].cb_idx = 0xFF;
6406 ioc->internal_lookup[i].smid = smid;
6407 list_add_tail(&ioc->internal_lookup[i].tracker_list,
6408 &ioc->internal_free_list);
6409 }
6410
6411 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->scsi_lookup_lock, flags);
6412
6413 /* initialize Reply Free Queue */
6414 for (i = 0, reply_address = (u32)ioc->reply_dma ;
6415 i < ioc->reply_free_queue_depth ; i++, reply_address +=
6416 ioc->reply_sz) {
6417 ioc->reply_free[i] = cpu_to_le32(reply_address);
6418 if (ioc->is_mcpu_endpoint)
6419 _base_clone_reply_to_sys_mem(ioc,
6420 reply_address, i);
6421 }
6422
6423 /* initialize reply queues */
6424 if (ioc->is_driver_loading)
6425 _base_assign_reply_queues(ioc);
6426
6427 /* initialize Reply Post Free Queue */
6428 index = 0;
6429 reply_post_free_contig = ioc->reply_post[0].reply_post_free;
6430 list_for_each_entry(reply_q, &ioc->reply_queue_list, list) {
6431 /*
6432 * If RDPQ is enabled, switch to the next allocation.
6433 * Otherwise advance within the contiguous region.
6434 */
6435 if (ioc->rdpq_array_enable) {
6436 reply_q->reply_post_free =
6437 ioc->reply_post[index++].reply_post_free;
6438 } else {
6439 reply_q->reply_post_free = reply_post_free_contig;
6440 reply_post_free_contig += ioc->reply_post_queue_depth;
6441 }
6442
6443 reply_q->reply_post_host_index = 0;
6444 for (i = 0; i < ioc->reply_post_queue_depth; i++)
6445 reply_q->reply_post_free[i].Words =
6446 cpu_to_le64(ULLONG_MAX);
6447 if (!_base_is_controller_msix_enabled(ioc))
6448 goto skip_init_reply_post_free_queue;
6449 }
6450 skip_init_reply_post_free_queue:
6451
6452 r = _base_send_ioc_init(ioc);
6453 if (r)
6454 return r;
6455
6456 /* initialize reply free host index */
6457 ioc->reply_free_host_index = ioc->reply_free_queue_depth - 1;
6458 writel(ioc->reply_free_host_index, &ioc->chip->ReplyFreeHostIndex);
6459
6460 /* initialize reply post host index */
6461 list_for_each_entry(reply_q, &ioc->reply_queue_list, list) {
6462 if (ioc->combined_reply_queue)
6463 writel((reply_q->msix_index & 7)<<
6464 MPI2_RPHI_MSIX_INDEX_SHIFT,
6465 ioc->replyPostRegisterIndex[reply_q->msix_index/8]);
6466 else
6467 writel(reply_q->msix_index <<
6468 MPI2_RPHI_MSIX_INDEX_SHIFT,
6469 &ioc->chip->ReplyPostHostIndex);
6470
6471 if (!_base_is_controller_msix_enabled(ioc))
6472 goto skip_init_reply_post_host_index;
6473 }
6474
6475 skip_init_reply_post_host_index:
6476
6477 _base_unmask_interrupts(ioc);
6478
6479 if (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged != MPI2_VERSION) {
6480 r = _base_display_fwpkg_version(ioc);
6481 if (r)
6482 return r;
6483 }
6484
6485 _base_static_config_pages(ioc);
6486 r = _base_event_notification(ioc);
6487 if (r)
6488 return r;
6489
6490 if (ioc->is_driver_loading) {
6491
6492 if (ioc->is_warpdrive && ioc->manu_pg10.OEMIdentifier
6493 == 0x80) {
6494 hide_flag = (u8) (
6495 le32_to_cpu(ioc->manu_pg10.OEMSpecificFlags0) &
6496 MFG_PAGE10_HIDE_SSDS_MASK);
6497 if (hide_flag != MFG_PAGE10_HIDE_SSDS_MASK)
6498 ioc->mfg_pg10_hide_flag = hide_flag;
6499 }
6500
6501 ioc->wait_for_discovery_to_complete =
6502 _base_determine_wait_on_discovery(ioc);
6503
6504 return r; /* scan_start and scan_finished support */
6505 }
6506
6507 r = _base_send_port_enable(ioc);
6508 if (r)
6509 return r;
6510
6511 return r;
6512}
6513
6514/**
6515 * mpt3sas_base_free_resources - free resources controller resources
6516 * @ioc: per adapter object
6517 *
6518 * Return nothing.
6519 */
6520void
6521mpt3sas_base_free_resources(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
6522{
6523 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
6524 __func__));
6525
6526 /* synchronizing freeing resource with pci_access_mutex lock */
6527 mutex_lock(&ioc->pci_access_mutex);
6528 if (ioc->chip_phys && ioc->chip) {
6529 _base_mask_interrupts(ioc);
6530 ioc->shost_recovery = 1;
6531 _base_make_ioc_ready(ioc, SOFT_RESET);
6532 ioc->shost_recovery = 0;
6533 }
6534
6535 mpt3sas_base_unmap_resources(ioc);
6536 mutex_unlock(&ioc->pci_access_mutex);
6537 return;
6538}
6539
6540/**
6541 * mpt3sas_base_attach - attach controller instance
6542 * @ioc: per adapter object
6543 *
6544 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
6545 */
6546int
6547mpt3sas_base_attach(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
6548{
6549 int r, i;
6550 int cpu_id, last_cpu_id = 0;
6551
6552 dinitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
6553 __func__));
6554
6555 /* setup cpu_msix_table */
6556 ioc->cpu_count = num_online_cpus();
6557 for_each_online_cpu(cpu_id)
6558 last_cpu_id = cpu_id;
6559 ioc->cpu_msix_table_sz = last_cpu_id + 1;
6560 ioc->cpu_msix_table = kzalloc(ioc->cpu_msix_table_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6561 ioc->reply_queue_count = 1;
6562 if (!ioc->cpu_msix_table) {
6563 dfailprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6564 "allocation for cpu_msix_table failed!!!\n",
6565 ioc->name));
6566 r = -ENOMEM;
6567 goto out_free_resources;
6568 }
6569
6570 if (ioc->is_warpdrive) {
6571 ioc->reply_post_host_index = kcalloc(ioc->cpu_msix_table_sz,
6572 sizeof(resource_size_t *), GFP_KERNEL);
6573 if (!ioc->reply_post_host_index) {
6574 dfailprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "allocation "
6575 "for reply_post_host_index failed!!!\n",
6576 ioc->name));
6577 r = -ENOMEM;
6578 goto out_free_resources;
6579 }
6580 }
6581
6582 ioc->rdpq_array_enable_assigned = 0;
6583 ioc->dma_mask = 0;
6584 r = mpt3sas_base_map_resources(ioc);
6585 if (r)
6586 goto out_free_resources;
6587
6588 pci_set_drvdata(ioc->pdev, ioc->shost);
6589 r = _base_get_ioc_facts(ioc);
6590 if (r)
6591 goto out_free_resources;
6592
6593 switch (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged) {
6594 case MPI2_VERSION:
6595 ioc->build_sg_scmd = &_base_build_sg_scmd;
6596 ioc->build_sg = &_base_build_sg;
6597 ioc->build_zero_len_sge = &_base_build_zero_len_sge;
6598 break;
6599 case MPI25_VERSION:
6600 case MPI26_VERSION:
6601 /*
6602 * In SAS3.0,
6603 * SCSI_IO, SMP_PASSTHRU, SATA_PASSTHRU, Target Assist, and
6604 * Target Status - all require the IEEE formated scatter gather
6605 * elements.
6606 */
6607 ioc->build_sg_scmd = &_base_build_sg_scmd_ieee;
6608 ioc->build_sg = &_base_build_sg_ieee;
6609 ioc->build_nvme_prp = &_base_build_nvme_prp;
6610 ioc->build_zero_len_sge = &_base_build_zero_len_sge_ieee;
6611 ioc->sge_size_ieee = sizeof(Mpi2IeeeSgeSimple64_t);
6612
6613 break;
6614 }
6615
6616 if (ioc->is_mcpu_endpoint)
6617 ioc->put_smid_scsi_io = &_base_put_smid_mpi_ep_scsi_io;
6618 else
6619 ioc->put_smid_scsi_io = &_base_put_smid_scsi_io;
6620
6621 /*
6622 * These function pointers for other requests that don't
6623 * the require IEEE scatter gather elements.
6624 *
6625 * For example Configuration Pages and SAS IOUNIT Control don't.
6626 */
6627 ioc->build_sg_mpi = &_base_build_sg;
6628 ioc->build_zero_len_sge_mpi = &_base_build_zero_len_sge;
6629
6630 r = _base_make_ioc_ready(ioc, SOFT_RESET);
6631 if (r)
6632 goto out_free_resources;
6633
6634 ioc->pfacts = kcalloc(ioc->facts.NumberOfPorts,
6635 sizeof(struct mpt3sas_port_facts), GFP_KERNEL);
6636 if (!ioc->pfacts) {
6637 r = -ENOMEM;
6638 goto out_free_resources;
6639 }
6640
6641 for (i = 0 ; i < ioc->facts.NumberOfPorts; i++) {
6642 r = _base_get_port_facts(ioc, i);
6643 if (r)
6644 goto out_free_resources;
6645 }
6646
6647 r = _base_allocate_memory_pools(ioc);
6648 if (r)
6649 goto out_free_resources;
6650
6651 init_waitqueue_head(&ioc->reset_wq);
6652
6653 /* allocate memory pd handle bitmask list */
6654 ioc->pd_handles_sz = (ioc->facts.MaxDevHandle / 8);
6655 if (ioc->facts.MaxDevHandle % 8)
6656 ioc->pd_handles_sz++;
6657 ioc->pd_handles = kzalloc(ioc->pd_handles_sz,
6658 GFP_KERNEL);
6659 if (!ioc->pd_handles) {
6660 r = -ENOMEM;
6661 goto out_free_resources;
6662 }
6663 ioc->blocking_handles = kzalloc(ioc->pd_handles_sz,
6664 GFP_KERNEL);
6665 if (!ioc->blocking_handles) {
6666 r = -ENOMEM;
6667 goto out_free_resources;
6668 }
6669
6670 /* allocate memory for pending OS device add list */
6671 ioc->pend_os_device_add_sz = (ioc->facts.MaxDevHandle / 8);
6672 if (ioc->facts.MaxDevHandle % 8)
6673 ioc->pend_os_device_add_sz++;
6674 ioc->pend_os_device_add = kzalloc(ioc->pend_os_device_add_sz,
6675 GFP_KERNEL);
6676 if (!ioc->pend_os_device_add)
6677 goto out_free_resources;
6678
6679 ioc->device_remove_in_progress_sz = ioc->pend_os_device_add_sz;
6680 ioc->device_remove_in_progress =
6681 kzalloc(ioc->device_remove_in_progress_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6682 if (!ioc->device_remove_in_progress)
6683 goto out_free_resources;
6684
6685 ioc->fwfault_debug = mpt3sas_fwfault_debug;
6686
6687 /* base internal command bits */
6688 mutex_init(&ioc->base_cmds.mutex);
6689 ioc->base_cmds.reply = kzalloc(ioc->reply_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6690 ioc->base_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6691
6692 /* port_enable command bits */
6693 ioc->port_enable_cmds.reply = kzalloc(ioc->reply_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6694 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6695
6696 /* transport internal command bits */
6697 ioc->transport_cmds.reply = kzalloc(ioc->reply_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6698 ioc->transport_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6699 mutex_init(&ioc->transport_cmds.mutex);
6700
6701 /* scsih internal command bits */
6702 ioc->scsih_cmds.reply = kzalloc(ioc->reply_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6703 ioc->scsih_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6704 mutex_init(&ioc->scsih_cmds.mutex);
6705
6706 /* task management internal command bits */
6707 ioc->tm_cmds.reply = kzalloc(ioc->reply_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6708 ioc->tm_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6709 mutex_init(&ioc->tm_cmds.mutex);
6710
6711 /* config page internal command bits */
6712 ioc->config_cmds.reply = kzalloc(ioc->reply_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6713 ioc->config_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6714 mutex_init(&ioc->config_cmds.mutex);
6715
6716 /* ctl module internal command bits */
6717 ioc->ctl_cmds.reply = kzalloc(ioc->reply_sz, GFP_KERNEL);
6718 ioc->ctl_cmds.sense = kzalloc(SCSI_SENSE_BUFFERSIZE, GFP_KERNEL);
6719 ioc->ctl_cmds.status = MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6720 mutex_init(&ioc->ctl_cmds.mutex);
6721
6722 if (!ioc->base_cmds.reply || !ioc->port_enable_cmds.reply ||
6723 !ioc->transport_cmds.reply || !ioc->scsih_cmds.reply ||
6724 !ioc->tm_cmds.reply || !ioc->config_cmds.reply ||
6725 !ioc->ctl_cmds.reply || !ioc->ctl_cmds.sense) {
6726 r = -ENOMEM;
6727 goto out_free_resources;
6728 }
6729
6730 for (i = 0; i < MPI2_EVENT_NOTIFY_EVENTMASK_WORDS; i++)
6731 ioc->event_masks[i] = -1;
6732
6733 /* here we enable the events we care about */
6734 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_SAS_DISCOVERY);
6735 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_SAS_BROADCAST_PRIMITIVE);
6736 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_SAS_TOPOLOGY_CHANGE_LIST);
6737 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_SAS_DEVICE_STATUS_CHANGE);
6738 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_SAS_ENCL_DEVICE_STATUS_CHANGE);
6739 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_IR_CONFIGURATION_CHANGE_LIST);
6740 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_IR_VOLUME);
6741 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_IR_PHYSICAL_DISK);
6742 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_IR_OPERATION_STATUS);
6743 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_LOG_ENTRY_ADDED);
6744 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_TEMP_THRESHOLD);
6745 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_ACTIVE_CABLE_EXCEPTION);
6746 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_SAS_DEVICE_DISCOVERY_ERROR);
6747 if (ioc->hba_mpi_version_belonged == MPI26_VERSION) {
6748 if (ioc->is_gen35_ioc) {
6749 _base_unmask_events(ioc,
6750 MPI2_EVENT_PCIE_DEVICE_STATUS_CHANGE);
6751 _base_unmask_events(ioc, MPI2_EVENT_PCIE_ENUMERATION);
6752 _base_unmask_events(ioc,
6753 MPI2_EVENT_PCIE_TOPOLOGY_CHANGE_LIST);
6754 }
6755 }
6756 r = _base_make_ioc_operational(ioc);
6757 if (r)
6758 goto out_free_resources;
6759
6760 ioc->non_operational_loop = 0;
6761 ioc->got_task_abort_from_ioctl = 0;
6762 return 0;
6763
6764 out_free_resources:
6765
6766 ioc->remove_host = 1;
6767
6768 mpt3sas_base_free_resources(ioc);
6769 _base_release_memory_pools(ioc);
6770 pci_set_drvdata(ioc->pdev, NULL);
6771 kfree(ioc->cpu_msix_table);
6772 if (ioc->is_warpdrive)
6773 kfree(ioc->reply_post_host_index);
6774 kfree(ioc->pd_handles);
6775 kfree(ioc->blocking_handles);
6776 kfree(ioc->device_remove_in_progress);
6777 kfree(ioc->pend_os_device_add);
6778 kfree(ioc->tm_cmds.reply);
6779 kfree(ioc->transport_cmds.reply);
6780 kfree(ioc->scsih_cmds.reply);
6781 kfree(ioc->config_cmds.reply);
6782 kfree(ioc->base_cmds.reply);
6783 kfree(ioc->port_enable_cmds.reply);
6784 kfree(ioc->ctl_cmds.reply);
6785 kfree(ioc->ctl_cmds.sense);
6786 kfree(ioc->pfacts);
6787 ioc->ctl_cmds.reply = NULL;
6788 ioc->base_cmds.reply = NULL;
6789 ioc->tm_cmds.reply = NULL;
6790 ioc->scsih_cmds.reply = NULL;
6791 ioc->transport_cmds.reply = NULL;
6792 ioc->config_cmds.reply = NULL;
6793 ioc->pfacts = NULL;
6794 return r;
6795}
6796
6797
6798/**
6799 * mpt3sas_base_detach - remove controller instance
6800 * @ioc: per adapter object
6801 *
6802 * Return nothing.
6803 */
6804void
6805mpt3sas_base_detach(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
6806{
6807 dexitprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s\n", ioc->name,
6808 __func__));
6809
6810 mpt3sas_base_stop_watchdog(ioc);
6811 mpt3sas_base_free_resources(ioc);
6812 _base_release_memory_pools(ioc);
6813 mpt3sas_free_enclosure_list(ioc);
6814 pci_set_drvdata(ioc->pdev, NULL);
6815 kfree(ioc->cpu_msix_table);
6816 if (ioc->is_warpdrive)
6817 kfree(ioc->reply_post_host_index);
6818 kfree(ioc->pd_handles);
6819 kfree(ioc->blocking_handles);
6820 kfree(ioc->device_remove_in_progress);
6821 kfree(ioc->pend_os_device_add);
6822 kfree(ioc->pfacts);
6823 kfree(ioc->ctl_cmds.reply);
6824 kfree(ioc->ctl_cmds.sense);
6825 kfree(ioc->base_cmds.reply);
6826 kfree(ioc->port_enable_cmds.reply);
6827 kfree(ioc->tm_cmds.reply);
6828 kfree(ioc->transport_cmds.reply);
6829 kfree(ioc->scsih_cmds.reply);
6830 kfree(ioc->config_cmds.reply);
6831}
6832
6833/**
6834 * _base_reset_handler - reset callback handler (for base)
6835 * @ioc: per adapter object
6836 * @reset_phase: phase
6837 *
6838 * The handler for doing any required cleanup or initialization.
6839 *
6840 * The reset phase can be MPT3_IOC_PRE_RESET, MPT3_IOC_AFTER_RESET,
6841 * MPT3_IOC_DONE_RESET
6842 *
6843 * Return nothing.
6844 */
6845static void
6846_base_reset_handler(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc, int reset_phase)
6847{
6848 mpt3sas_scsih_reset_handler(ioc, reset_phase);
6849 mpt3sas_ctl_reset_handler(ioc, reset_phase);
6850 switch (reset_phase) {
6851 case MPT3_IOC_PRE_RESET:
6852 dtmprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6853 "%s: MPT3_IOC_PRE_RESET\n", ioc->name, __func__));
6854 break;
6855 case MPT3_IOC_AFTER_RESET:
6856 dtmprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6857 "%s: MPT3_IOC_AFTER_RESET\n", ioc->name, __func__));
6858 if (ioc->transport_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
6859 ioc->transport_cmds.status |= MPT3_CMD_RESET;
6860 mpt3sas_base_free_smid(ioc, ioc->transport_cmds.smid);
6861 complete(&ioc->transport_cmds.done);
6862 }
6863 if (ioc->base_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
6864 ioc->base_cmds.status |= MPT3_CMD_RESET;
6865 mpt3sas_base_free_smid(ioc, ioc->base_cmds.smid);
6866 complete(&ioc->base_cmds.done);
6867 }
6868 if (ioc->port_enable_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
6869 ioc->port_enable_failed = 1;
6870 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status |= MPT3_CMD_RESET;
6871 mpt3sas_base_free_smid(ioc, ioc->port_enable_cmds.smid);
6872 if (ioc->is_driver_loading) {
6873 ioc->start_scan_failed =
6874 MPI2_IOCSTATUS_INTERNAL_ERROR;
6875 ioc->start_scan = 0;
6876 ioc->port_enable_cmds.status =
6877 MPT3_CMD_NOT_USED;
6878 } else
6879 complete(&ioc->port_enable_cmds.done);
6880 }
6881 if (ioc->config_cmds.status & MPT3_CMD_PENDING) {
6882 ioc->config_cmds.status |= MPT3_CMD_RESET;
6883 mpt3sas_base_free_smid(ioc, ioc->config_cmds.smid);
6884 ioc->config_cmds.smid = USHRT_MAX;
6885 complete(&ioc->config_cmds.done);
6886 }
6887 break;
6888 case MPT3_IOC_DONE_RESET:
6889 dtmprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT
6890 "%s: MPT3_IOC_DONE_RESET\n", ioc->name, __func__));
6891 break;
6892 }
6893}
6894
6895/**
6896 * mpt3sas_wait_for_commands_to_complete - reset controller
6897 * @ioc: Pointer to MPT_ADAPTER structure
6898 *
6899 * This function is waiting 10s for all pending commands to complete
6900 * prior to putting controller in reset.
6901 */
6902void
6903mpt3sas_wait_for_commands_to_complete(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc)
6904{
6905 u32 ioc_state;
6906
6907 ioc->pending_io_count = 0;
6908
6909 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 0);
6910 if ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) != MPI2_IOC_STATE_OPERATIONAL)
6911 return;
6912
6913 /* pending command count */
6914 ioc->pending_io_count = atomic_read(&ioc->shost->host_busy);
6915
6916 if (!ioc->pending_io_count)
6917 return;
6918
6919 /* wait for pending commands to complete */
6920 wait_event_timeout(ioc->reset_wq, ioc->pending_io_count == 0, 10 * HZ);
6921}
6922
6923/**
6924 * mpt3sas_base_hard_reset_handler - reset controller
6925 * @ioc: Pointer to MPT_ADAPTER structure
6926 * @type: FORCE_BIG_HAMMER or SOFT_RESET
6927 *
6928 * Returns 0 for success, non-zero for failure.
6929 */
6930int
6931mpt3sas_base_hard_reset_handler(struct MPT3SAS_ADAPTER *ioc,
6932 enum reset_type type)
6933{
6934 int r;
6935 unsigned long flags;
6936 u32 ioc_state;
6937 u8 is_fault = 0, is_trigger = 0;
6938
6939 dtmprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: enter\n", ioc->name,
6940 __func__));
6941
6942 if (ioc->pci_error_recovery) {
6943 pr_err(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: pci error recovery reset\n",
6944 ioc->name, __func__);
6945 r = 0;
6946 goto out_unlocked;
6947 }
6948
6949 if (mpt3sas_fwfault_debug)
6950 mpt3sas_halt_firmware(ioc);
6951
6952 /* wait for an active reset in progress to complete */
6953 if (!mutex_trylock(&ioc->reset_in_progress_mutex)) {
6954 do {
6955 ssleep(1);
6956 } while (ioc->shost_recovery == 1);
6957 dtmprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: exit\n", ioc->name,
6958 __func__));
6959 return ioc->ioc_reset_in_progress_status;
6960 }
6961
6962 spin_lock_irqsave(&ioc->ioc_reset_in_progress_lock, flags);
6963 ioc->shost_recovery = 1;
6964 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->ioc_reset_in_progress_lock, flags);
6965
6966 if ((ioc->diag_buffer_status[MPI2_DIAG_BUF_TYPE_TRACE] &
6967 MPT3_DIAG_BUFFER_IS_REGISTERED) &&
6968 (!(ioc->diag_buffer_status[MPI2_DIAG_BUF_TYPE_TRACE] &
6969 MPT3_DIAG_BUFFER_IS_RELEASED))) {
6970 is_trigger = 1;
6971 ioc_state = mpt3sas_base_get_iocstate(ioc, 0);
6972 if ((ioc_state & MPI2_IOC_STATE_MASK) == MPI2_IOC_STATE_FAULT)
6973 is_fault = 1;
6974 }
6975 _base_reset_handler(ioc, MPT3_IOC_PRE_RESET);
6976 mpt3sas_wait_for_commands_to_complete(ioc);
6977 _base_mask_interrupts(ioc);
6978 r = _base_make_ioc_ready(ioc, type);
6979 if (r)
6980 goto out;
6981 _base_reset_handler(ioc, MPT3_IOC_AFTER_RESET);
6982
6983 /* If this hard reset is called while port enable is active, then
6984 * there is no reason to call make_ioc_operational
6985 */
6986 if (ioc->is_driver_loading && ioc->port_enable_failed) {
6987 ioc->remove_host = 1;
6988 r = -EFAULT;
6989 goto out;
6990 }
6991 r = _base_get_ioc_facts(ioc);
6992 if (r)
6993 goto out;
6994
6995 if (ioc->rdpq_array_enable && !ioc->rdpq_array_capable)
6996 panic("%s: Issue occurred with flashing controller firmware."
6997 "Please reboot the system and ensure that the correct"
6998 " firmware version is running\n", ioc->name);
6999
7000 r = _base_make_ioc_operational(ioc);
7001 if (!r)
7002 _base_reset_handler(ioc, MPT3_IOC_DONE_RESET);
7003
7004 out:
7005 dtmprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: %s\n",
7006 ioc->name, __func__, ((r == 0) ? "SUCCESS" : "FAILED")));
7007
7008 spin_lock_irqsave(&ioc->ioc_reset_in_progress_lock, flags);
7009 ioc->ioc_reset_in_progress_status = r;
7010 ioc->shost_recovery = 0;
7011 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&ioc->ioc_reset_in_progress_lock, flags);
7012 ioc->ioc_reset_count++;
7013 mutex_unlock(&ioc->reset_in_progress_mutex);
7014
7015 out_unlocked:
7016 if ((r == 0) && is_trigger) {
7017 if (is_fault)
7018 mpt3sas_trigger_master(ioc, MASTER_TRIGGER_FW_FAULT);
7019 else
7020 mpt3sas_trigger_master(ioc,
7021 MASTER_TRIGGER_ADAPTER_RESET);
7022 }
7023 dtmprintk(ioc, pr_info(MPT3SAS_FMT "%s: exit\n", ioc->name,
7024 __func__));
7025 return r;
7026}
